07052.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at West Orange Public Library 46 Mount Pleasant Ave., West Orange, NJ, Wednesdays 6:00-9:00 p.m., October 10, 17, 24, 31, November 7 & 14, 2018. Volunteers work once per week for two hours or more and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 225, via email emartin@lvaep.org, or register through our website www.lvaep.org.
07052.title: Tough times; here's how you can help
07052.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07201.description: Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children across this country are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another, and are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment and even prison as adults. CASA was created to ensure the abuse and neglect these children suffered at home doesn't continue at the hands of the system. CASA trains volunteers to become advocates who are then appointed by judges to be a voice for these children in court and in their community. The goal is for each child to be placed into a safe, loving home where he/she have permanency and can thrive. Interns with CASA of Union County volunteer with our development and program staff to ensure the organization has the resources and support necessary to do this critical work. CASA of Union County seeks interns each semester to help staff continue to make CASA thrive and reach as many abused, neglected and abandoned children as possible. Some recent intern responsibilities include: Entering and analyzing case data; Organizing and prepping for special events; Developing outreach materials and engaging in community outreach; Drafting articles for newsletters; Creating social media content; Updating paper and digital case files for program staff; Attending court with staff and volunteer advocates; Preparing training materials; Assisting with volunteer recognition; and Researching opportunities to expand the volunteer base. Interns commit to working approximately 10-15 hours per week for the semester. Fall interns generally work September to December; Spring interns generally work January to May; Summer Interns generally work May to August. Start and end dates are flexible based on school schedules. To apply, please contact Lisa at 908-293-8135 or lporis@casaofunioncounty.org to request our internship application.
07201.title: Child Advocacy Fall Internships at CASA of Union County

AmeriCorps Members dedicate one year of their life to serve communities throughout the United States that are in need. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). Position Type: Full-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete: 1700 Bi-weekly Financial Stipend: $528.84 Total Stipend Amount: $13,750.00 Educational Award: $5,920.00 *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448 Service Activities/Responsibilities: Case management using wraparound principles, and building of programs Active role in fundraising activities for social services program Integrating food pantry and case management for clients that require complex interventions Facilitating employment (resume building, job openings, etc.) Working closely and collaborating with Case Manager Special projects as assigned Occasional home visits Conducting initial and ongoing assessment of client(s) that includes information such as medical, psychological, economic, and social factors Arranging and executing additional programming Know Your Rights Trainings Financial Literacy Service Goals: Increasing food security for clients through food pantry Increasing capacity of SMILE to meet community needs Economically empowering clients to become self sufficient Providing quality service with genuine care and attention Maintaining accurate and up-to-date records Maintaining client confidence and confidentiality Position Requirements/Qualifications Commitment, Patience, Flexibility Problem solving & analytical skills Effective communication skills Bachelors in Social Work or related training/certification NJ Licensed Social Worker or New Jersey State Licensure for MSW. Fluency in Arabic a plus Training and Evaluation Attend meetings, in-service and training sessions identified by SPCDC AmeriCorps Program and Smile for Charity. Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week, and events sponsored by the Corporation for National & Community Service.

07205.description: Marketplace in Hillside is a project dedicated to battling hunger and poverty in our community. The Community FoodBank of New Jersey provides a meaningful volunteer experience in a positive, safe environment that is perfect for individuals, families, and groups of almost any size. Each year the FoodBank relies on more than 25,000 volunteers. Volunteer today and make a measurable difference in the lives of many by, helping sort and organize the food pantry, and package the items for distribution to needy families. 11375.description: We have to sites to registers. Central Queens Y in Forest Hills - https://drm.nybloodcenter.org/ PublicScheduler/GroupLanding. aspx?s=19434 The Samuel Field Y in Little Neck - https://drm.nybloodcenter.org/PublicScheduler/GroupLanding.aspx?s=70132 One pint of blood can save up to 3 lives because blood can be divided into different components. You must be between the ages of 16 and 75 to donate blood (16 year olds need parental permission. Age 76 and over need doctor’s note). You must weigh at least 110 lbs. to donate. It is perfectly safe to donate blood every 56 days. You will need identification with photo or signature. Eat well and drink plenty of fluids before donating. If you cannot make your appointment time, please come when you can. We need every donor! Is there someone else you would like to bring along to donate?

11101.description: The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring. Afternoon Conversation Groups, October 2 - November 29: When: Tuesdays and Thursdays Time: 1:00pm to 2:00pm Afternoon Writing Partners, October 10 - November 29: When: Mondays and Wednesdays Time: 1:00pm to 2:00pm Evening Conversation Groups, October 10 - December 6: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays Time: 5:45pm to 6:45pm Evening Writing Partners, October 10 - December 6: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays Time: 5:45pm to 6:45pm The aim of Conversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. For more information, please email mculhane@lagcc.cuny.edu for afternoon sessions, and marpena@lagcc.cuny.edu for evening sessions.

08872.description: JOIN THE MOVEMENT TO PROTECT OUR CHILDREN: ATTEND OUR FALL TRAINING CLASS OCTOBER 16 - NOVEMBER 15TH, 6PM - 9:30PM, Monday and Thursday Evenings Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) is seeking volunteers to advocate for children who have been abused or neglected. On any given day, more than 350 children from Middlesex County are living in foster care. Now, more than ever, we need you. A child with a CASA is more likely to find a permanent home, spend less time in foster care, and perform better in school. Champion one of these children from your community and safeguard a child’s well being through advocacy in the court today. What does a CASA do? A CASA is integral in helping the Court in determining the appropriate permanent plan for the child. We ensure abuse and neglect doesn’t continue at the hand’s of the court. A CASA forges a connection with the child/children they are matched with. They build their trust and discover what their needs are. Once a month they visit with their assigned child. Advocates examine the child's health and education records and meet with their caregivers, school, therapists and other professionals. Once they identify what the child’s needs are, they write a report and advocate for a child’s needs in court. Our staff and peer coordinators are with you every step of the way to support you and help you succeed. No special skills or specific backgrounds are needed. Advocates must be able to commit to 18-24 months of service. Visit www.casaofmiddlesexcounty.org/volunteer for an application or call (732) 246.4449 or email info@casaofmiddlesexcounty.org
08872.title: Child Advocate:  Fall 2018 Training Class

11104.description: Interpretation/Translation Volunteer at Catholic Migration Services Our Immigration program seeks volunteers to provide translation and interpretation services. Our greatest need is for persons who are bilingual in Spanish and English. This is a great opportunity for foreign language students looking to practice their language skills over the summer! Volunteer activities: Provide language interpretation services in our office. Both consecutive interpretation and simultaneous interpretation skills are welcome. Assist in our weekly Housing Intake Clinics every other Tuesday from 11-5pm by interpreting attorney-client meetings and providing general support to staff attorneys Translate foreign language documents into English. Examples of typical documents include birth certificates, affidavits, diplomas or degrees from foreign institutions, medical records, and foreign language news articles. Training will be provided. All services will be supervised by a staff attorney. For those who need to report pro bono hours, we will track the number of hours worked. Qualifications: Must be fluent in a second language to provide interpretation and translation services. Spanish- English skills are in greatest demand. Court certification is not required. Commit to at least 3 housing intake clinics which take place every other Tuesday from 11-5 p.m. in our Queens office Who We Are: Founded in 1971, Catholic Migration Services is committed to \"welcoming the stranger in our midst,\" by empowering underserved immigrant communities in Brooklyn and Queens. We provide high quality legal services, know-your-rights education, and advocacy to immigrants to advance equality and social justice in a changing and diverse population. Our services are available without regard to national origin, religion or immigration status. Catholic Migration Services is a not-for-profit corporation with 501(c)(3) status and affiliated with Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens and the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn. Site: Tenant Advocacy Program language assistance volunteers may work at our Queens office located at 47-01 Queens Blvd, Suite 201, Sunnyside, NY 11104. Contact: Katie Searle, Volunteer Coordinator Email: ksearle@catholicmigration.org Phone: (718) 236-3000 ext. 204
11104.title: ARE YOU BILINGUAL? Volunteer this Summer as a Legal Interpreter/Translator!

07921.description: Expect Miracles Foundation - Financial Services Against Cancer is hosting their Inaugural Atlantic Coast Classic. Expect Miracles Foundation rallies the financial services industry to invest in life-saving cancer research and advance patient care programs nationwide. Expect Miracles Foundation - Financial Services Against Cancer is proud to introduce the Inaugural Expect Miracles Atlantic Coast Classic. We invite the New York and New Jersey financial communities and beyond to join us at Fiddler's Elbow Country Club on September 17 in Bedminster Township, NJ. Over 250 senior financial industry executives will hit the links, to rally together and raise funds for cancer research. In addition to supporting the fight against cancer, this is a great networking opportunity for volunteers who will be assisting with registration, on course contests, and more. Volunteers can choose to work a Morning Shift, Evening Shift or a Full Day Shift. Volunteer Responsibilities will include helping with registration, donation programs, auction programs, contests and setting up behind the scenes. Registration: checking in guests, directing guests, distributing gift bags etc. Donation program: selling opportunity drawing tickets, mulligans etc. Auction Program: moderate silent auction, live auction spotter, check-out Contests: overseeing putting contest, poker game, longest drive, etc. Behind the Scenes: registration set-up, auction set-up, break down Volunteer Schedule: 6:30 a.m. Volunteers Arrive/Orientation 7:30 a.m. - 8:45 a.m. Golfers Arrive/Registration 9:00 a.m. sharp Shotgun Start 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. On Course Activities 2:00 p.m. Cocktail Reception Begins 3:00 p.m. - 3:30 p.m. Awards & Live Auction 4:00 p.m. Thank you and Goodnight 4:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m. Wrap Up and Break Down Shift #1: 6:30 a.m. - 3:00 p.m Shift #2: 10:00 a.m - 5 p.m Full Day: 6:30 a.m - 5 p.m *Flexible based on your schedule. Volunteers can sign up for nay shift. Full Day is preferred.

10027.description: Market Access Program Intern Start Small Think Big (Start Small) is a not-for-profit organization located in Harlem. Our mission is to help under resourced individuals build and sustain thriving businesses in order to increase their personal financial security and stimulate economic activity in underserved communities in New York City. We believe that entrepreneurship results in increased innovation and sustained economic growth for everyone, in particular, those most traditionally marginalized. The Market Access Program Intern will work with the Marketing Program Manager to assist our entrepreneurs with marketing and sales business needs. This includes developing resource guides, learning more about sales opportunities in NYC and online, and supporting our communications team with a social media strategy. Job Responsibilities shall include, but are not limited to: Assist in managing Start Small Think Big social media platforms, including creating and posting content, identifying influencers in the space, and responding to comments and questions received from entrepreneurs. Research and develop informative resource guides focused on assisting entrepreneurs in identifying and addressing business challenges and community resources necessary to increase business success. Support the Marketing Program Manager in delivering services, via workshops, consultations, and project-based relationships, this includes managing logistics of events, coordinating entrepreneur attendance, and all necessary follow-up calls. Assist in developing the evaluation rubrics used by volunteer marketing experts to help entrepreneurs identify weaknesses in their current marketing practices. Preferred Skills/Qualifications: Current undergraduate student with strong interest in writing, social media, and communications, nonprofit program management, or other related disciplines. High level of computer proficiency including familiarity with Google Applications, social media (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) and MS Office. Knowledge of programs: Buffer and Canva a plus. Demonstrated commitment to inclusive community/economic development, social and economic justice work, and/or anti-poverty work. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, time management, and interpersonal skills; Highly organized, creative and self-motivated; a strong problem-solver and analytical/critical thinker; and Experience working in low-income and/or immigrant communities. TO APPLY: Submit resume to: Eliza Edge, Market Access Program Manager at eliza@startsmallthinkbig.org (include subject line: \"[your name] Market Access Program Intern.\" This position is unpaid, but may be used for course credit where appropriate. Minimum of 20 hours/week at our office. Days are flexible. Start Small Think Big is an equal opportunity employer with a standing policy of nondiscrimination. This means that all qualified persons are accorded an equal opportunity for employment or promotion without regard to actual or perceived race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibility, personal appearance, genetic information, matriculation, or political affiliation.
10027.title: Market Access Program Intern - Fall

10027.description: Artistic Noise Board of Directors Job Posting Job Description: As we enter our 18th year at Artistic Noise we are seeking new board members to support our organization’s growth. From our roots as a small program fiscally sponsored by an umbrella non-profit at Boston College, we have grown to become an independent 501(c)(3) organization. We moved from the \"incubator\" to \"startup\" phase in 2010, and now are building out more robust infrastructure to ensure we can offer our programs to more youth in need. Our mission is narrowly focused and we are experts at the work we do having refined our programmatic model over our 18 years. That said, we need our board to support the business of running a nonprofit, by Sharing their professional expertise and advice, Providing philanthropic support, Actively connecting Artistic Noise to the right people, resources, and partnerships. We ask that board members make a commitment of 3 years to Artistic Noise and participate in quarterly board meetings and committee meetings as needed. Candidates should be located in the Greater Boston or NYC areas. Desired Qualifications and Responsibilities: Participate in at least one of the standing committees (Governance, Finance, Development, Strategic Planning) Actively fundraise for the organization through your personal giving, networks, and more broadly. Have 3+ years experience in either the nonprofit or corporate sectors. Have experience/expertise in at least one of the following areas: finance, accounting, marketing, development, public relations, law. Some prior board experience preferred, but not required. This is a volunteer, unpaid position. Believe in the mission of Artistic Noise. About Artistic Noise: Mission and Purpose Artistic Noise exists to bring the freedom and power of artistic practice to young people who are incarcerated, on probation, or otherwise involved in the justice system. Through visual arts and entrepreneurship programs in Massachusetts and New York, our youth artists give voice to their experiences, build community through collaborative projects, and learn valuable life and job skills. Artistic Noise creates safe spaces where court-involved youth can be seen, heard and supported on their path to adulthood. We believe the practice of making art offers opportunities for young people and communities to transform. About our Programs By working with youth both in state custody and back in the community, Artistic Noise provides continuity for young people who are often experiencing trauma and upheaval in their lives. Our staff of teaching artists and licensed art therapists works with our participants to create safe, challenging spaces for creative expression. Using a variety of artistic mediums, youth explore themes such as friendship, loss, sexual violence, community, freedom, identity and their dreams for the future. This structured artmaking fosters critical thinking and problem solving skills that are beneficial to the teens' healthy psychological development. https://www.artisticnoise.org/ How to apply: Please submit your resume/cover letter to tamara.scarlett@artisticnoise.com and/or Amanda.holm@artisticnoise.com
10027.title: Artistic Noise seeks new member for Board of Directors

07040.description: Join our tutor training workshop in Maplewood, NJ and help an adult learn to read and write English. You can begin helping an adult by the end of the month and earn our certificate as a trained tutor of English for Speakers of Other Languages and Basic Literacy after only 18 hours of tutoring. We also provide monthly professional development workshops for tutors. Please respond with a phone number and email address, if you'd like to register and begin training tomorrow. Our 18-hour training course takes place at the Hilton Branch of Maplewood Memorial Library, 1688 Springfield Avenue, Maplewood, NJ 07040, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 1:00-4:00 pm, October 17, 22, 24, 29, 31, & Nov. 5, 2018. In Essex County, 28-percent of all adults are considered functionally illiterate: They can't read to their children, help with homework, or write a note to, or read a note from, a child's teacher. At Literacy Volunteers of America, we teach basic literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) to adults. Why not share your gift of literacy? Please help us fight illiteracy. Call Ellen at 973-566-6200, ext. 217, to register, or email emartin@lvaep.org for registration information. More info: www.lvaep.org/
07040.title: Become a trained literacy volunteer and help an adult learn to read!
07040.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07701.description: DESCRIPTION: Move for Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a creative, talented, and enthusiastic videography and production intern. The selected candidate will work directly with the Art Director, Executive Director, and Communications Manager to create videos that will help raise awareness about hunger. This is a great opportunity for any self-motivated candidate looking to build their portfolio. TIME COMMITMENT: 2-4 days/week. Minimum 10 hrs/week in our Red Bank office. Part-time availability during the semester. Additional remote hours may be needed for editing. REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Knowledge and experience with Adobe Premiere & AfterEffects Familiarity with Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator Experience with graphic design a plus** Experience with 2D and/or 3D animation a plus** Must be able to work cohesively and collaborate in a team environment Must be organized, detail oriented, proactive, and deadline-driven A portfolio that showcases your many talents (required with interview) Open to constructive feedback Candidate must use his/her own laptop during the course of the internship - however, extra monitor will be provided Must have a great understanding of our mission, goal, and audience DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Lead and/or assist with the production of all video and media projects Assist in selecting, organizing, and editing footage Collaborate with other teams to arrange video shoots Produce dynamic content for YouTube & social media channels Produce branded stock video openings & closings Develop storyboard ideas for new content and videos Combine Animation & Video Local off-site shooting Absorb creative direction while bringing unique ideas and a point of view to the table Attend brainstorm sessions and video meetings Adhere to Move For Hunger’s brand and style guide Perform additional administrative tasks as needed, assigned by the Art Director COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please send a cover letter, resume, and portfolio to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \"VIDEOGRAPHY & PRODUCTION INTERNSHIP\"
07701.title: Videography & Production Internship | Fall 2018

07701.description: DESCRIPTION: Move For Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a dynamic, self-starter interested in learning about new media, also known as social media, communications. This internship is an excellent opportunity to experience how social media is used in a professional, non-profit setting, while working for an exciting young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT Minimum 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Red Bank office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior, or graduate level students, or recent college graduates Preferred Majors: Communication, Journalism, Media Studies, Digital Communication, Public Relations, Marketing, English, Health Studies, Social Work, Public Health, Non-profit Management, Business Administration MS Office Proficiency Social Media Proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Outgoing Personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in learning more about social media strategy DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: This position will work directly with the Communications Manager and Director of External Affairs. Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Assist in planning and executing social media campaigns Identify and track social media coverage Maintain knowledge of current events and trends within hunger relief and food waste fields Assist in developing social media strategies for a variety of goals Amplify website content through social media posts Assist in developing, organizing, and implementing awareness and giving campaigns Assist program directors with operational initiatives and member communications COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" NEW MEDIA COMMUNICATIONS INTERNSHIP\"
07701.title: New (Social) Media Communications Internship | Fall 2018

07701.description: DESCRIPTION: Move For Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a dynamic, self-starter interested in learning about marketing and relationship management to join their Programming Team. The Program Management Intern will help expand the organization’s network of moving companies, real estate professionals, and corporate housing providers by supporting the Programming Team with member recruitment, engagement, participation, communications, and encouraging the network to collect food for communities across the United States and Canada. This internship is an excellent opportunity for a student or professional interested in gaining experience in customer relations, marketing, membership management, and non-profit organizational processes, while working for a young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT: 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Red Bank office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: College or graduate level students, recent graduates, or professionals looking to change careers MS Office Proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Proactive and self-motivated, yet team-oriented Superior organizational skills and attention to detail Outgoing Personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in making a difference in the community DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Assist with recruitment efforts to expand the Move For Hunger network Assist with member retention and participation campaigns Assist with high volume telephone and email communications with new and existing members Data entry, such as recording food donations or researching food banks Writing and executing social media posts Managing, organizing, and executing mailings, including thank you letters and welcome kits COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" PROGRAM MANAGEMENT INTERNSHIP\"
07701.title: Program Management Internship | Fall 2018

07701.description: Move for Hunger, a national hunger-relief 501(c)3 organization, seeks a creative, motivated, enthusiastic candidate interested in learning more about professional graphic design. The selected candidate with work directly with the events and communications team to help raise awareness about hunger through event fliers, posters, banners, info graphics, and images for social media. REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Extensive knowledge and experience with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Indesign Must be able to work cohesively in a team environment and collaborate Must be organized, detail oriented, and able to meet deadlines Photography, Microsoft Office knowledge, videography, Adobe Premiere, Adobe AfterEffects are a plus A portfolio that showcases your many talents (required with interview) Be open to constructive feedback Working in a team oriented environment Candidate must use his/her own laptop during the course of the internship DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Tasks include but are not limited to: Creating visual content for website and individual posts to our blog/ events section Creating flyers, banners, posters, and marketing materials for food drives and other events Creation of layout and design for internal and external collateral materials Creation of info graphics for social media canpaigns Input into layout redesign of existing material Attending brainstorm sessions and communication/design meetings Adhering to Move For Hunger's brand and style guide Perform additional administrative tasks as needed, assigned by the Art Director TO APPLY: Please send cover letter, resume, and portfolio to intern@moveforhunger.org with the subject line \" GRAPHIC DESIGN INTERNSHIP\"
07701.title: Graphic Design Internship | Fall 2018

This internship is an excellent opportunity to experience various aspects of non-profit administration while working for an exciting young award-winning hunger-relief organization. TIME COMMITMENT: 2-3 days/week Minimum 14 hrs/week in our Red Bank office REQUIREMENTS/QUALIFICATIONS: Freshman, Sophomore, Junior, Senior, or graduate level students, or recent college graduates Preferred Majors: Communication, Journalism, Media Studies, Digital Communication, Public Relations, Marketing, English, Health Studies, Social Work, Public Health, Non-Profit Management, Business Administration MS Office proficiency Excellent written and oral communication skills Outgoing personality with outstanding interpersonal skills Interest in making a difference in the community DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Duties and responsibilities will vary from day to day, however, possibilities include the following: Help plan and facilitate food drives and fundraisers, incorporating members and media promotion, as appropriate Assist with the identification and development of member engagement opportunities Create, promote, and maintain fundraising campaign Research current trends within the hunger relief and food waste fields Contribute to social media and web site content Assist with events that may occur locally and help recruit volunteers COMPENSATION: This is an Unpaid/Volunteer internship TO APPLY: Please a send cover letter and resume to intern@moveforhunger.org, with the subject line \" EVENT MANAGEMENT INTERNSHIP\"

07042.description: Each year, United Way of Northern New Jersey works with individuals, families, businesses, service clubs, faith-based groups and large companies to collect new school supplies for children from families who are struggling financially. YOU can help us! We need volunteers to run collection drives, donate needed school supplies and to volunteer to assist us with sorting, organizing and packing the school supplies for the children, partner non-profits and partner schools. the drop off date and on-site volunteer date is August 31, but drives and collections can be done anytime leading up to then. We have flyers and other materials that are available for any one interested in using them. If you have questions or need more information, please don't hesitate to contact us. Please feel free to sign up and let us know if you are interested in helping provide local children in need with a good start to the school year.
07042.title: Tools for School - Montclair Area
07042.org: United Way of Northern New Jersey

07042.description: The Montclair Community Farms serve as handson resources that engage the community in urban farming, sustainable agriculture, affordable food access, and healthy food and lifestyle choices. Our goal is to provide local seniors with access to fresh produce by sending our mobile farm stand to their buildings. In order to do this, we need your help to make sure our farms are growing! Please come prepared to work outdoors by wearing clothing that can get dirty, dressing in layers, wearing close toed shoes, and bringing water to drink. All ages welcome! Children under 12 should be accompanied by an adult. For the 16 Miller Street location, please use street parking and locate the green pick up truck to sign in with our farmers. This farm is in a residential community and is hard to locate.
07042.title: Plant It Forward with Montclair Community Farms!

07042.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your children's teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at Montclair Public Library, 50 S. Fullerton Ave., Montclair, NJ 07042 on Saturdays 12;15 p.m. to 3:45 p.m. September 8, 15, 22, 29 & October 6, 2018 . Volunteers work once per week for two hours or more and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 217, via email emartin@lvaep.org, or register through our website www. lvaep.org.
07042.title: Times are hard, you can help!
07042.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07042.description: The Board of Trustees at The Montclair Inn is looking to expand! We currently have 9 board members and we are looking for more volunteers with specific areas of expertise. Most importantly, we are looking for individuals who are interested in supporting our mission. We are a small non-profit in the heart of Montclair, NJ that provides affordable housing for seniors ages 55+. These are the skills that we are searching for: 1. A person with a passion for fundraising who would work along with our Executive Director and plan our yearly major fundraiser and a few smaller events. 2. A person who has an interest in/passion for marketing and communications who would assist with creating our newsletter and keeping our social media current. 3. A person who has a background in technology. to help our Executive Director with various online projects. Each individual Montclair Inn Board Member is expected to know the organization’s mission, policies, programs, and needs faithfully read and understand the organization’s financial statements serve as active advocates and ambassadors for the organization and fully engage in identifying and securing the financial resources and partnerships necessary for the organization to advance its mission leverage connections, networks, and resources to develop collective action to fully achieve the organization’s mission give a meaningful personal financial donation help identify personal connections that can benefit the organization’s fundraising and reputational standing, and can influence public policy prepare for, attend, and conscientiously participate in board meetings participate fully in one or more committees Thank you for your interest in The Montclair Inn!
07042.title: Searching for New Members for our Board of Trustees

07043.description: Embrace Relief is a nonprofit, humanitarian organization that believes in diversity, compassion, and humanity and uses these values each and every day to help those in need live a better, more sustainable life. Embrace Relief will be having a food drive at ACME of Montclair, New Jersey on Saturday, August 25th, from 11am-3pm. We will need some helping hands to set up our equipment outside the store, collect food and monetary donations from willing customers, and pack up when the food drive is finished. Embrace Relief is a great organization to volunteer with because we take pride in what we do and help make lives better every day. An email will be sent to each individual who signs up, please respond to that email if you are interested in participating in our food drive!
07043.title: Volunteers Needed for Food Drive!

10455.description: We are seeking dedicated volunteers to provide tutoring and homework help to elementary and middle school students at our South Bronx community center. Masa's After-school Program operates on weekday evenings ( Mondays-Thursdays) from 6 PM-8PM. At the program, students receive homework help, grow as readers, learn how to set goals and achieve them, and engage in critical thinking about the world around them. Masa's 2018-2019 After-School Program (MAP) will start on September 12, 2018 and run through May 23, 2019. Volunteers are admitted on a rolling basis. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer consistently for at leastone of the following days: Monday (6 PM - 8 PM); Tuesday (6 PM - 8 PM); Wednesday (6 PM - 8 PM); or Thursday (6 PM - 8 PM). Able to commit to volunteering for all or most of the 2018-2019 academic year (college students who will leave NYC in May are still eligible to volunteer). When working with children, consistency is the key to success! Willingness and ability to serve as a tutor/homework facilitator to elementary or middle school students in an individual or small group setting. Willingness and ability to discuss topics related to social justice with students. These include discussing the Black Lives Matter movement, immigrant rights, the history of indigenous people in the Americas, and LGBTQIA rights. Attend mandatory Masa trainings and events (provided advance notice and multiple options for scheduling). Committed to following all Masa policies and procedures, including with respect to confidentiality Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Interested in applying? Fill out our interest form. For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: A love for education grows in the Bronx!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our twelve-week Fall Robotics program in which Masa scholars hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus on the local community. The Fall Robotics Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx) When: The Fall Robotics Program will begin on September 22 nd, 2018 and will end on December 15 th, 2018 Time: The Fall Robotics Program will operate on Saturdays from 1:00 pm - 3:30 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer on a weekly basis Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Willingness to work with scholars in grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12) Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction Attend fall interactive showcase Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Volunteer with a Fall Robotics Program!

10455.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10044.description: We are providing an amazing volunteer opportunity to help us smoothly and successfully put on a run/walk that will raise money and awareness of colorectal cancer, which is the 2nd leading cause of cancer death in the U.S. The day of the race we need volunteers who will arrive early to help us set up tables, tents, a memory wall, etc. We will also need volunteers who will help direct runners and walkers throughout the run/walk course, hand out water, help with registration, T-shirt and race packet pick up, Lastly we will need volunteers to help us take everything down and pack up. We will have refreshments for all our volunteers and t-shirts! For those who need it, we will also write referral letters for all the hard work you do that day via email for those volunteers who sign-n and provide their information.
10044.title: 2018 NYC Undy RunWalk

10044.description: Did you know that colorectal cancer is the 2nd leading cause of cancer death in the US, yet it is one of the most preventable forms of cancer? By volunteering for our 5k, the Undy RunWalk you can help change that! We have found that by getting people talking about this disease, we can save lives. Date: Saturday, September 22, 2018 Location: Firefighter's Field, Roosevelt Island, NYC HOW WE NEED YOUR HELP THE DAY OF THE EVENT: -Early Shift- Set up expo area Registration and runner check in Food & Beverage Tent -Later Shift- Water stations Course cheering Course marshaling Clean Up Event Photographer Please note we are also happy to validate or confirm any hours needed for school or community service. TO SIGN UP AS A VOLUNTEER, FILL OUT THIS FORM: https://coloncancer.tfaforms.net/41 OR CONTACT: Kelly Russo, Director of RunWalk krusso@ccalliance.org About The Colorectal Cancer Alliance: The Colorectal Cancer Alliance is a community that provides hope and support to patients and their families, while saving lives through prevention, research, and patient support services. www.ccalliance.org
10044.title: Help Us Kick Colorectal Cancer's Butt-Volunteer for the NYC Undy RunWalk!!

10044.description: We need friendly, energetic volunteers ready to donate their time on event day to a great cause. Volunteer shifts are typically 3-4 hours in length, and you can sign up to volunteer with family or friends. Volunteers help with responsibilities like: Set-up and Breakdown Registration Refreshments Course Marshaling Start/Finish Line Water Stops Each year, thousands of patients need a marrow transplant but have no donor match in their families. They depend on Be The Match to help them find an unrelated marrow donor and receive treatment. The cure for blood cancers like leukemia, lymphoma, and 70 other life-threatening diseases is in the hands of ordinary people - your hands. Be The Match Walk+Run raises funds to help patients with uninsured treatment costs, support continued marrow transplant research to improve outcomes, and add more potential volunteer marrow donors to Be The Match Registry, giving more patients hope for a cure. You'll receive the training you need to feel comfortable in your volunteer role, a t-shirt, and the appreciation of everyone who works to help marrow transplant patients. Please sign up to be an event day volunteer and encourage your family and friends to join you! Sign up to be an event day volunteer by visiting www.bethematchwalkrun.org/newyork and scrolling down to the Volunteer button in the middle of the page. Encourage your family and friends to sign up also! Email bethematchwr.newyork@nmdp.org with questions.
10044.title: Be The Match Walk+Run New York

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. You will be working with the child under our Fight Free Program which pairs a tutor and a child together from the child’s art form that they choose. It is a 12-week program consisting of One Hour per week continuously checking in with the Programs Director as well as updating the Child Life Specialist and Psychologist about what you have been teaching the child. You will work closely with the Programs Director to create a 12-week plan for the child. We are seeking a talented Piano Tutor to work with a child affected by cancer.

10128.description: Learning Through Art Volunteer Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum is seeking volunteers to support teaching artists in New York City public school classrooms where the Learning Through Art (LTA) program is implemented. LTA Volunteers should be enthusiastic about arts education/integration and able to make a commitment to assist a teaching artist one day each week for the duration of the 20-week residency. LTA places teaching artists in New York City public school classrooms, where they collaborate with teachers to create process-oriented art projects that examine ideas and themes related to the school curriculum. In these 20-week residencies, teaching artists introduce art techniques and concepts and encourage students to view, analyze, and discuss works of art. Founded in 1937, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation is dedicated to promoting the understanding and appreciation of art, architecture, and other manifestations of visual culture, primarily of the modern and contemporary periods. The Guggenheim realizes this mission through exceptional exhibitions, education programs, research initiatives, and publications. The Guggenheim strives to engage and educate an increasingly diverse international audience through its unique network of museums and partnerships. With nearly three million annual visitors worldwide, the Guggenheim and its network is one of the most visited cultural institutions in the world. Responsibilities of a LTA Volunteer include: Distribute all art materials to students as directed by teaching artist. Help to maintain an organized classroom throughout each session and manage clean-up and storage of materials. Photograph (when advised by teaching artist) students at work in the classroom. Photograph one individual work for each student in February/March to be included in the catalog and exhibition slide show. Assisting the teaching artist in hanging in-school exhibitions and other displays of student artwork throughout the year As advised by teaching artist, work with students one-on-one and in small groups as needed. Helping with LTA events as needed, including family days at the Guggenheim Museum This is a volunteer position. Volunteers receive invitations to Guggenheim programs, free admission to museums across the country, discounts at the Guggenheim restaurants and store and the opportunity to learn about art education, museum education and modern and contemporary art. If you have any questions, please feel free to email learningthroughart@guggenheim.org. Volunteer commitment is once weekly from approximately mid-October through early May. TO APPLY: Please complete the LTA volunteer application found at www.guggenheim.org/lta. Email with a cover letter and résumé to learningthroughart@guggenheim.org or mail to Learning Through Art, 1071 Fifth Avenue, New York, NY 10128.
10128.title: Learning Through Art Volunteer
10128.org: Solomon R Guggenheim Museum, Learning Through Art

This BBQ is an opportunity for our residents to come together as friends and neighbors, and enjoy the final days of summer in the presence of the volunteers they so very much enjoy. Please join us. As a volunteer, your first priority is to engage with our residents in a warm and compassionate way, making them feel more at home within their walls. 11206.description: Mentoring Kids Through Tennis Kings County Tennis League (KCTL) is a registered 501c3 non-profit that uses tennis as an instrument for mentorship and community building in Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. We literally bring tennis to the children’s communities. KCTL is seeking enthusiastic individuals who are comfortable working with kids and ready to develop their roles as mentors.Tennis skills are helpful, but not required. For the summer season, our free classes are Saturday mornings, June 2 through September 22, at the following sites in Bedford Stuyvesant, BK: Lafayette Gardens, Marcy, Sumner, Tompkins and Jackie Robinson. Volunteers must commit to a minimum number of classes. Duties for each class included: tossing tennis balls, giving out high fives, directing and communicating with students, and teaching If you have a tennis background. Basically, however, you will serve as a positive role model that the kids look forward to seeing each day. All volunteers are required to undergo a background check and training. Volunteers will receive a KCTL team jersey and invites to special volunteer events as a thanks for all their hard work. Please fill out a KCTL registration form if you’re interested, or contact rob@kingscountytennisleague.org.
11206.title: Mentor Kids through After-School Tennis

10023.description: Hello! We are a family-run charity English school based in China's Dragon City. If you're aiming to make a difference, travel or are taking a gap year then we might just be what you're looking for. We are searching for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10023.title: Want a Genuinely Wonderful China Experience? Join D&A Charity School and Become an English

10023.description: Centro NYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can be available weekday evenings to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Greeting students and managing class check-in, as well as new student registrations -Facilitating nightly break sessions between classes, by preparing/breaking down snack preparations, managing snack sales, and encouraging students to practice language skills -Participating in major marketing initiatives for the organization -Preparing monthly 'Intercambio' events - student mixers -Admin office tasks such as assisting teaching staff, checking voicemails and returning calls Commitment: Volunteers will be expected to meet either Tuesdays, Wednesday OR Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:00pm beginning Thursday September 20th and ending on Thursday, December 20th. If time constraints exist, there may be flexibility around start/end times for shifts. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/ Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge.

Duties include: Learning/Working with a donor application program for entries and reporting Learning/Working with the creation and design of new/revised agency department brochures and website content Learning/Working and supporting the planning, organizing, and day to day functions that lead up to Golf Event on Monday, September 17, 2018. This includes ongoing marketing, sponsorship solicitation, community outreach, social media marketing, recruiting, and all on-site day of event operations. Learning/Working and supporting the planning, organizing, and day to day functions that lead up to fall Gala Reception Event on Friday, November 2, 2018. This includes ongoing marketing, sponsorship solicitation, community outreach, social media marketing, recruiting, and all on-site day of event operations. Learning/Working on Constant Contact, an online marketing program used for E-Newsletters Learning/Working on the Camp Jotoni Capital Campaign including assisting with outreach and marketing The hours needed for this internship/volunteer opportunity will vary based on the individual's schedule however, we are looking for a total of 3-4 hours per week Monday-Friday.

06830.description: Marketing volunteers will join our marketing committee. Marketing seeks to generate Foundation of Hope (FoH) interest and to develop strategies that encourage involvement and investment in FoH's mission. Marketing handle public relations, website, social media communications, newsletters, annual report and other marketing projects. Identify and recruit community leaders to serve with Board members. They also engage in advocacy, campaigning and networking. Marketing volunteers will develop communications with media and press. Requirements: Attend 1 hour monthly meeting in person or via conference call Volunteer 2 hours per week Social media knowledge Proof-reading ability Ability to work independently or as part of a team Press releases Branding Knowledge graphic design Knowlege of branding
06830.title: Marketing

10020.description: As an Office Support Assistant, you have the opportunity to support the administrative functions of our agency in various capacities and settings. Duties include, but are not limited to : filing, copying, creating and maintaining data, program specific projects, and managing telephone lines. Office Support Assistants are needed in all five boroughs! This role is ideal for someone who has: · Clerical skills · Typing skills · Experience with Microsoft Word · Customer Service experience (preferable) Time commitment and hours are flexible. Please complete a volunteer profile and inquire with the volunteer team for more information: volunteer@jbfcs.org
10020.title: Office Support Assistant
10020.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10605.description: On Saturday, October 13th, 2018 riders of all skill levels will travel through scenic Westchester and Fairfield counties in support of this charity bike ride fundraising for autism research. Beginning and ending in Saxon Woods Park, the event offers four route options and a 5K walk to appeal to cyclists and walkers of all ages and experience levels. This fully-supported ride benefits the Autism Science Foundation which helps fund scientists and organizations conducting autism research. We are looking for volunteers to help on the routes and at the event site. Throughout the event, as a member of a volunteer team, you'll keep the riders and 5K walkers happy. You may be assigned to an \"oasis\" (rest stop) team, or you may drive a sweep vehicle, or perhaps you'll help serve breakfast and lunch - there are opportunities for almost every interest! We also have specialty teams for medical positions, bike techs, and people who own a motorcycle. Regardless of your interests and abilities, there's a volunteer team for you. For more information on volunteering, please contact ttimken@globalimpactpro.com. Register to volunteer for Wall Street Rides FAR today! Thank you for your help and consideration to support autism research within the community.
10605.title: Volunteer for Wall Street Rides FAR 2018!

11220.description: Welcome to D&A! We are a charity school based in China and we are looking for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
11220.title: Paid Teaching Role for Charity School - Learn to Teach, Travel China and Make a Difference

11220.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. Womankind's Brooklyn Community Office holds monthly Movies and Communitiesevent open to the community on the last Friday of every month. After a movie screening, a discussion group is held for viewers to share their thoughts and reflect on the film. We are seeking volunteers who can provide Mandarin interpretation during the event. The volunteer would be present throughout the duration of the screening and especially active during the discussion group. Dates: 7/27/18, 8/31/18, 9/28/18. 10/26/18, 11/30/18, 12/21/18 Time: 4-7pm Please email volunteer@iamwk.org with the subject \"Spanish interpreter\" if interested.
11220.title: Mandarin Interpreter

07030.description: Our mentors come from all different backgrounds, but they all share a passion for supporting our children. TRUE Mentors is built around the idea that through healthy, encouraging relationships our greatest potential can be unearthed. When a child has the love, support and encouragement from a dedicated mentor and friend, there is no end to the possibilities life presents. TRUE Mentors encourages Mentors and Mentees to create their own schedule and engage in activities they both enjoy. In partnership with the Boys and Girls Club of Hoboken, we offer classes once a week for our mentors and children to participate in together. Check out our great list of activities on our calendar. Wondering whether you’d be a good TRUE Mentor? Here is an overview of some of the requirements: 21 years or older Live in and around Hoboken, NJ Willing and able to commit a year to a relationship with a mentee Willing and able to spend a minimum of 8 hours per month with a mentee The desire to change the course of a child’s life as well as their own TRUE Mentors will interview you, train you and help you get fingerprinted
07030.title: Male Youth Mentoring in Hoboken

07033.description: The New Jersey Maywood MDA office is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming golf outing at the Galloping Hill Golf Course in Kenilworth, NJ on Wednesday, October 3rd. We are in need of around 10 volunteers to set up and breakdown the event, greet guests, assist with registration, and setting up silent auction items. If you or anyone you know is looking for an opportunity to volunteer, or is in need of service hours, please contact our office. Volunteers should plan to arrive around 8:15am and stay until around 2:00pm. The success of our events depends heavily on volunteers; if you want to do something for a worthy cause and make a difference - please contact our office.

07032.description: Did you know? In New Jersey: 17% of adults lack basic literacy skills 12% have not earned a high school diploma 20% of those without a high school diploma are living in poverty 18% of NJ residents have limited English ONLY 3% of NJ adults who lack a diploma or don't speak English well are currently receiving services There is a tremendous need for adult literacy services in Kearny. 37% of Hudson County residents were found to lack basic prose literacy skills (compared to a State average of 17 percent). 41% of residents are foreign-born (compared to 21.8 for the State), 62.5% speak a language other than English. For many immigrants, opportunities for meaningful work and economic self-sufficiency, is depended on their ability to speak English and that's why we NEED YOU. Join Our Team of Tutors Changing Lives Literacy NJ West Hudson Programs is recruiting volunteer tutors to help adult learners improve their literacy skills. Tutors receive 10 hours of training during four sessions they will learn to lead a small ESL conversation group. The curriculum is provided, and tutors sign up for one semester at a time. We're looking to for fall tutors NOW! Tutors pick their own schedule. The training is offered 5:30 to 8 p.m. on September 18th, 20th, 25th, and 27th at the Kearny Branch Library, 759 Kearny Avenue. For information or to register, call 201-998-3336 or email slomax@literacynj.org.
07032.title: Volunteer ESL Tutor
07032.org: Literacy New Jersey - West Hudson Programs

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike! 9/23/18

07039.description: We are looking for a very special volunteer to assist with the presentation of art lessons to primary and middle school students with special needs. Volunteer will work with a team of two other volunteers. Materials and lessons provided, you bring the pizazz! Volunteer must be high energy and animated during the presentation of lessons to capture the attention of children and to build excitement for the activity. Volunteer must also have the ability to switch gears when appropriate to show calm and patience while encouraging students in their efforts. Looking for a volunteer who is a natural at building people up! Organizational skills and clear-thinking are essential. Volunteer will need to bring class through a series of steps to create their artwork and disseminate supplies at key points while also tracking their usage. Volunteer will also be in charge of maintaining supplies. Volunteer will be needed for Tuesdays 9:30am-12:00pm 9/11-12/11. Availability for all Tuesdays is a must. This is a great opportunity for anyone with an art therapy background or a college student going into special ed or OT, SLP or PT (not a requirement.) No need to be a professional artist but you should consider yourself crafty and creative.

10701.description: Afya takes pride in three areas The Afya Foundation collects medical supplies and equipment from throughout the United States and ships these critical materials to health initiatives worldwide. Our model recognizes that each hospital, government and clinic abroad faces disparate public health conditions. We sort and categorize rescued supplies in order to ship individually tailored shipments to each partner. Our regional network of medical supply donors and volunteers enables Afya to meet immediate humanitarian needs in areas devastated by natural disaster, public health crises or international conflicts in tandem with our long-term programs to address chronic health disparities. By reducing the amount of unused medical supplies in the US, Afya promotes efficient and environmentally aware healthcare practices at home while sustaining life abroad. of expertise: RESCUEsurplus materials from hospitals utilizing a socially responsible and environmentally green mechanism. SORTdonations with local volunteers engaged in our unique, structured and meaningful volunteer programs. DELIVERhigh quality specifically requested materials thereby increasing access to healthcare in areas with urgent supply needs. Medical Volunteers Needed - Nurses, Doctors, Clinicians, Medical Technicians Unique volunteer opportunity for medical professionals in a non-traditional community-based setting.The medical knowledge of healthcare professionals is essential for our ability to tailor the contents of each shipment to the treatment needs of our health care system partners in urgent need. Volunteers will assist with: Organizing a steady stream of donated medical supplies and surgical equipment in order to allow for medical supplies to be inventoried and shipped to partners in need: Sorting donated surplus medical supplies or Identifying and labeling medical supplies If you would like more information about this great opportunity, please call (914) 920-5081 or email: Marygrace.pagaduan@afyafoundation.org
10701.title: Medical Volunteers Needed

10701.description: Afya's mission is to improve global health by rescuing surplus medical supplies and delivering them to underserved health systems around the world. Our triad of objectives includes: To improve the quality of and access to healthcare in underserved communities while providing a simple mechanism for US healthcare institutions and professionals to improve global health standards. To reduce the environmental impact in our own country by diverting \"waste\" from landfills and incineration. To provide unique and structured opportunities for local volunteers from vulnerable populations to engage in altruistic activities. Come help us sort through donated consumable, personal care, surgical and medical supplies. We have a 15,000 square feet warehouse in Yonkers, NY where volunteers help us sort and organize items donated items to be shipped to Africa or the Caribbean nations. These critical medical supplies and equipment aids countries devastated by natural disasters and supports our long-term programs to address chronic health disparities in developing nations.
10701.title: Medical Supply Sorter

Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor
