11238.description: click here.Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynlibrary.org. To register to attend a Literacy Volunteer Information Session, please click here.
11238.title: Literacy Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11238.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11238.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynlibrary.org/. To register for a volunteer information session, please click here.

10562.description: What does the Parent Child Together Program Do? Parent Child Together provides parents with peer-to-peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. What do the Volunteers Do? In the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months - if possible (there is flexibility for vacations etc.)
10562.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer in Ossining

10018.description: Global Green is seeking help from a volunteer with experience in financial modeling to contribute to our work with supporting cities in planning for increased resource efficiency and reduction of waste materials. The use of wastewater treatment plants for \"co-digesting\" food waste allows for existing infrastructure, and the creation of biogas from the waste. Biogas can be used to generate electricity or transport fuel, and the compost or digestate by-product is used as a fertilizer. This is a part of a larger project. Links with more information are provided below: Resilience Planning: https://www.globalgreen.org/blog/xl8faarys9e758zfyj3pa58raddm5p Circular Economy Planning: https://www.globalgreen.org/blog/m9dt388wwr55brtem28fn32fgbfz89 The volunteer will receive information from Global Green collected from sources including case studies of cities currently creating biogas from food waste, and from an EPA excel tool. After an initial meeting the volunteer will prepare a basic financial model that goes deeper into cash flow projections for different project types and sizes over a 5, 10 and 20 year period. Results will be explained to the Global Green team, and any needed additional research to complete the model and its assumptions will be provided by Global Green.
10018.title: NYC Based Financial Modeling Volunteer Needed for Biogas Project
10018.org: Coalition for Resource Recovery Global Green USA

We are looking for volunteers and interns looking to make a difference in the area of fundraising. We are looking for people who: Have great social skills Are organized and reliable Have the ability to contribute and develop fundraising ideas Are comfortable making request in the area of money Please, send me an email at alex@nyunlockingfutures.org or give me call at (212) 791-4927 ext. 263. I will be happy to answer any questions. Visit our website nyunlockingfutures.org

10018.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking two (2) efficient and detail-oriented Database Administrative Volunteers to join their team! Fiver;s Database Administrative Volunteers ill work with Fiver's Operations and Accounting Department i a fast-paced work environment. Responsibilities for this position include but or not limited to, recording important information about the participants who attended and will attend Camp Fiver, Fiver's Summer Residential Program. This information is crucial when evaluating the success of Camp Fiver, evaluating and seeking funding, scheduling of Camp Programs, and maintaining pertinent contact information about Fiver Families. Fiver's Database Administrative Volunteers will assist Fiver in making a positive impact on the lives of youth throughout New York City and Central New York by successfully fulfilling the responsibilities of the volunteer position. Responsibilities include: Review Camp Fiver 2018 Applications and Health Forms Enter and update information collected from Fiver's 2018 Camp Applications Check for accuracy regarding addresses, Program Stages and assigned Session for each participant Conduct outreach for outstanding documents Any additional tasks related to this position as assigned Requirements for this position: Detail oriented Self-starter who can execute assignments independently A strong work ethic and sets high standards for his/her/their own work Strong organizational skills Analytical skills Experience with data entry and Excel preferred Language Skills Required: Spanish speaking preferred, but not required Fiver's Administrative Volunteers will: Attend a training on the software that will be used throughout the volunteer position Play a crucial role in a nonprofit that makes a 10-year commitment to youth throughout New York City and central New York and empowers them to make ethical and healthy life choices, become engaged citizens, and succeed in school, careers, and life. Be a member of a vibrant and divers team of staff members and volunteers Develop professionally through this volunteer position Assist Fiver Children's Foundation with the organization of information regarding Fiver participants who attended and will be attending Camp Fiver this summer Time Commitment: Must be able to commit a minimum of 10 - 15 hours on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday Dates: May 2018 - August 2018 If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please email your resume to casie@fiver.org.
10018.title: Database Administrative Volunteer

07090.description: Have you ever been told you are a good listener? Are you looking for a flexible, rewarding volunteer opportunity? Are you an empty nester? Are you an active older adult with extra time on your hands? Do you have a yearning to really make a difference? Become a Caring and Crisis Hotline Listener. You could save a life. Volunteers receive 52 hours of comprehensive training in active listening, Mental Health First Aid and Applied Suicide Intervention Skills Training. You also are supported by seasoned listeners during 24 hours of internship before you answer calls on your own. Even once you are a certified listener, we provide a range of support and training opportunities so you can continue to develop your skills. Join our listening community. Our next volunteer training will be held: September 12, 2018 - December 12, 2018 7 pm - 10 pm One evening weekly Plus one full weekend - 12/1 and 12/2 Westfield Presbyterian Church 140 Mountain Ave, Westfield NJ 07090 Register Now! Registration is limited. Cost includes all materials and certifications for Mental Health First Aid and ASIST To learn more and apply, please log onto http://caringcontact.org/volunteer-listener-application/ or call 908.301.1899
07090.title: Become a Caring and Crisis Hotline Listener

10013.description: Team Lead: We are currently looking for individuals passionate about making a difference to join Shine as team lead to help bridge the gap between Shine, our clients and partner sites. 10013.description: Facilitator: We are looking for facilitators who are engaging, energetic and can make financial content exciting and fun! Successful facilitators understand the importance of engagement and user experience in the teaching process and have the client’s interests in mind. Responsibilities: Facilitate classes, one or multiple classes over a scheduled program. Design activities and lesson plans. Work with support team to create long-term follow-up and success plans. Facilitators can specialize in topics (e.g., budgeting, credit repair, job search, etc.) or serve as generalists. Conduct research and preparation for classes as needed. Qualifications: 3+ years of prior experience working with similar client population OR prior facilitation/teaching experience. Strong communication skills. Introspective humility. Experience creating content or lesson plans that are fun and exciting! Ability to work well in a team environment. Timeframe: September-November with possibility to extend volunteer time. Weekly commitment: 4 to 6 hours + travel to sites

10013.description: We're seeking a fun and energetic person to volunteer as TZ the IDF Zebra at a Walk for PI event near you! This is the perfect volunteer opportunity for someone who: has an outgoing & creative personality with a willingness and desire to have fun; is willing to perform wacky activities & is good with spontaneous crowd-interaction; has good interpersonal skills (especially with children) & can work well with IDF staff members; is comfortable performing in front of a crowd (experience with dancing, acting, etc. is helpful but not required); is reliable and punctual; has strong non-verbal communication skills; is willing to represent the Immune Deficiency Foundation, our mission & core values, in a positive manner; is in good physical condition, between 5'6 - 5'10 tall & able to work in a costume. 10013.description: Lend a hand to support the Immune Deficiency Foundation’s (IDF) Walk for Primary Immunodeficiency!! This annual event raises awareness and funds to support people with primary immunodeficiency (PI) diseases. IDF is a national organization committed to serving individuals with primary immunodeficiency and their families. Contact us today to sign up for the available shifts! Please note that anyone 18 or older should complete their own separate volunteer sign-up registration. Join us on Sunday, October 21, 2018 for our signature fundraising event at Foley Square. We are looking for event day volunteers, 15 years or older to assist in a variety of different areas, such as: registration, route support, set-up, clean-up, and much more! This is the perfect volunteer opportunity for families and groups! We have a variety of shifts to fit your busy schedule. 6:30a-8:30a 8:00a-12:00p 9:30a-1:00p ALL DAY (6:30a-1:00p) ATTENTION! PLEASE READ IF YOU ARE A GROUP LEADER. If you are a group leader with (5) or more volunteers please contact Evette Watson at ewatson@primaryimmune.org. We can accommodate small groups of 5-10 people.
10013.title: Volunteer at the (New York) IDF Walk for Primary Immunodeficiency!

11231.description: Love to eat? Want to eat, drink, experience new restaurants, chefs, food establishment folks while doing good? Then, volunteer for our 4th Tastes of Brooklyn Carroll Gardens-Cobble Hill Summer Crawl - a Food Fest. You can join us anytime that day, to help set up, or work during the event, or breakdown. Event: Saturday, Sept. 29 Time: 2-6 pm People buy tickets for 4 tastes for $20 or 11 tastes for $50 and walk along Court and Smith and Henry Streets in Brooklyn, below Atlantic Avenue, just off the F and G trains at Bergen and Carroll Streets. We need volunteers to buy a ticket at tastesofbrooklyn.com to support Seeds in the Middle (seedsinthemiddle.org) work to empower kids in central Brooklyn's food deserts to create healthy choices. In the past, we have had more than 20 restaurants taking part along Smith, Court and Henry Streets, between Atlantic Avenue and 4th Street in Carroll Gardens. We are still welcoming more for this event. What you can do! work beside chefs to serve food at restaurants or mark tickets lead a group tour (you'd need to gather info first about the restaurants first so you can talk about it - great experience for someone who wants to be a tour guide - email us at tastesofbrooklyn.com) lead a group of kids on a scavenger hunt (where they have to find clues at different restaurants and when they get all them, win a prize) work our youth-run Hip2B Healthy Market, where youth serve fresh OJ, parfaits, air-popped popcorn to show healthy snacks can be delicious! hand out flyers put up flyers help us advertise and sell tickets anything else you can think of to make this a success No experience needed. Just be reliable. You don't have to do the whole time, just volunteer at least two hours, preferably four. Email us at tastesofbrooklyn@gmail.com Like Tastes of Brooklyn on Facebook Follow us on Instagram and Twitter. These wonderful restaurants are donating food to support kids in underserved neighborhoods. Help us show them love and build their small businesses, too.
11231.title: Cooks! Food Lovers Wanted -  Sept. 29 in Carroll Gardens, BK Crawl

11231.description: Eat. Drink. For Good. Help us plan and expand Tastes of Brooklyn's Carroll Gardens-Cobble Hill FALL Crawl - scheduled for SATURDAY, SEPT.29 TIME: 2-6 PM TICKETS: 4 tastes for $20, 11 tastes for $50 Supporting Seeds in the Middle's student-run Hip2B Healthy Markets, Chef Nights and edible gardens in schools, and our soccer program for at-risk and underserved children in central Brooklyn and beyond!!! We give community service credits, recommendation letters, you name it. Great for anyone looking to expand contacts in culinary and hospitality industries and just to intern this summer! Help us: Reach out to food and drink establishments from Atlantic Ave. south along Court, Henry, Smith Sts. Publicize in any way you know - help hand out flyers anywhere Social Media - post on food sites or just share on your Instagram, Snapchat, Facebook, etc. Get friends and family to buy tickets! Help chefs plan menus Day of - help chefs and participants Reach out to tourist businesses and encourage them to bring groups Day of and before - run Hip2B Healthy juice stands in neighborhood to show what we do If you like summer cocktails, help us organize a cocktail competition or something like that :) GUEST CHEFS WELCOME! HELP US PLAN ACTIVITIES OR DO ACTIVITIES IN CARROLL PARK - MUSIC, ART, DANCE, ACTIVITIES FOR KIDS, ALL IDEAS WELCOME! If you love food and drink , like planning events, are organized, detail oriented and outgoing, please join us. PLEASE NOTE - We depend on all volunteers to buy a ticket themselves to the event. You get amazing food. Please invite all you know. Must be reliable. Email us at tastesofbrooklyn@gmail.com and tell us what you can do and when you are available. Website: tastesofbrooklyn.com
11231.title: Foodie? Chef? Event planner? Join Tastes of BK Carroll Gdns-Cobble Hill Crawl

10011.description: Junior Board Member volunteers make a personal and professional commitment to fundraising by supporting the Board of Directors, a group of compassionate and motivated individuals who have dedicated their time to support our non profit organization. Junior Board Members brainstorm, select, organize and participate in fundraising activities. It’s an opportunity to not only help support women with breast cancer but also to network with accomplished and experienced people. The Ideal Junior Board Candidate: -A track record of leadership, is passionate about the success and mission of You Can Thrive!. -Desire to bring creativity, energy, knowledge and skills to the Board. -Professional behavior demonstrated in in the ability to keep commitments and complete projects -An understanding of the importance of communication -A student who is currently enrolled or a recent college graduate -All students are welcome to apply however any Fraternity or Sorority members who would like to join as a group would be ideal. We believe students who join as a group will be able to work as a team and support one other but this is not a requirement -Submit most recent transcripts and a resume How Junior Board Members make an impact: -Provide perspective and input to the Chief Visionary Officer, Resources Coordinator and Board of Directors -Participate in donor development through various strategies and engage members of the community in supporting the organizations work -Contribute to society in a positive way by helping facilitate our goal in providing free/ low cost integrative services to women diagnosed with cancer
10011.title: Junior Board of Directors Volunteer

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Charity Walk Committee Members Needed - NYC

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of an event chair to lead our organizational committee! Position Summary: Serve as the Lead Event Organizer, overseeing the event from beginning to end. Organize/recruit, motivate and lead a committee of other volunteers as they recruit teams, obtain sponsorship, and plan the event details. Roles and Responsibilities Work with Operations Chair and Staff Partner to follow all Children’s Tumor Foundation policies and procedures as well as state laws and local ordinances as well as the program standards. Know and be able to articulate the CTF mission, vision and messaging points. Recruit volunteer committee leads to manage the various aspects of the event (such as: Media & Publicity, Logistics, Operations, Recruitment, Event Volunteers). Work with Staff Partner to schedule committee meeting dates, develop agendas and facilitate committee meetings. Monitor progress of committee chairs through regular communication to ensure tasks are completed. Enforce accountability with committee members for assigned tasks and the overall event goals. Adhere to pre-approved budget through work with Staff Partner. Assist with identification of the appropriate person to succeed you as Chair. Arrange for appropriate recognition of sub-committee members and event day volunteers. Preferred Skills and Experience: Previous fundraising event organization is preferred but not essential. Organizational skills including general organizing, planning, time management, scheduling, coordinating resources and meeting deadlines. Comfort speaking in front of a group or potential sponsor Excellent communication skills Ability or experience overseeing the work of others. Spreadsheet and/or Google Drive knowledge and experience is a plus. Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
10011.title: New York Experienced Event Organizer Wanted -NYC

10010.description: Since 2003, OHNY Weekend has opened the doors of hundreds of incredible buildings and sites across the five boroughs of New York City, offering an extraordinary opportunity to experience the city and meet the people who design, build, and preserve New York. OHNY invites you to join our team of over 1,000 volunteers who help to make OHNY Weekend one of New York's most exciting events! Volunteers are assigned to one of over 200 sites or tours and provide support by welcoming visitors from around New York and around the world and acting as a representative of Open House New York. Volunteer for one shift (typically 4 hours) and receive a 2018 limited edition OHNY Weekend t-shirt, as well as a volunteer button that gives you and a friend expedited access to sites that do not require reservations throughout the Weekend. Volunteer registration is open until September 9, 2018. Why volunteer for OHNY Weekend? OHNY needs you! Since the first OHNY Weekend in 2003, volunteers have been and continue to be crucial to the success of the event. Without the dedicated support of volunteers, producing an event of the size and scale of OHNY Weekend simply would not be possible. Volunteering also gets you... * The opportunity to meet others who share your interest in architecture, design, history, and New York City's built environment * Expedited access for you and a friend at all OHNY Weekend sites that do not require Advance Reservations * A limited-edition OHNY volunteer t-shirt and OHNY volunteer passport, which identifies you as an official OHNY volunteer * An advanced digital copy of the OHNY Weekend Event Guide What is the time commitment to volunteer? All OHNY volunteers will: * Attend a required 90-minute orientation session * Complete one volunteer shift (average shift is four hours long) on Friday, Saturday, or Sunday of OHNY Weekend, October 12-14, 2018. What do volunteers do? Volunteers work one four-hour shift at one of our participating sites, and may help out with any of the following: * Greeting visitors * Assisting with crowd control and directing visitors to certain areas * Answering general questions about the site and about OHNY Weekend * Managing lines * Managing sign-ups for OHNY’s mailing list and counting visitors
10010.title: Call for Volunteers interested in Architecture, Design and NYC History: Open House New York Weekend

We are looking for a photographer (must have own camera) to take photographs before and during the event. Following the event we ask that they photos are uploaded to our Flickr account. Directions will be send following the event. Event Details Date: Tuesday, September 25, 2018 Location: Cipriani 42nd Street - 110 East 42nd Street, New York, NY 10017 Dress Attire: Coat and Tie If you are interested in volunteering for this event or would like more information please reach out to Sarah Johnston at sarah.johnston@nmss.org.

10017.org: National MS Society - New York City

10017.description: Welcome to D&A! We are a charity school based in China and we are looking for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10017.title: Paid Teaching Role for Charity School - Learn to Teach, Travel China and Make a Difference

10017.description: Each year, thousands of people across the country join the Bike MS volunteer team. From planning event details and calling past participants to providing safety and support for riders at the event, volunteers make Bike MS happen, and are the foundation of why Bike MS is the largest cycling fundraising event in the country. Join us in the National MS Society office to prepare for Bike MS: New York City. We have a variety of date and shifts available (listed below). If you are interested in volunteering please register here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f0944acab22abfd0-2018510. 10017.title: Office Volunteers needed for Bike MS: NYC!

10016.description: Thanks so much for wanting to make a difference. We are recruiting volunteers to be group facilitators for children ages 5-17 (groups are divided according to age), as well as event and fundraising helpers. Please view below for the volunteer type requirements and descriptions. The family and children group sessions are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and harlem. I invite you to visit our website at www.acaringhand.org to learn more about us and to acquire an application: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf. Feel free to contact me directly at RobinGoodman@acaringhand.org for more information or to send A Caring Hand application. View our video about our group program directly at https://vimeo.com/90184263 or on our website, acaringhand.org VOLUNTEER TYPES AND REQUIREMENTS 1) GROUP FACILITATORS: Group facilators must complete an application, have an interview, and attend a 8-12 hour training. One year commitment is required to co-facilitate the child and teen groups. 11 wee group session is held 3 times per year, summer, fall and winter ( Sept - June). A monthly drop in session is held Sept-June. Attendance at a 11 week session is a minimum requirement. In certain circumstances, a commitment for the monthly groups can be accommodated. Group facilitators are assigned to weekly groups during the weekdays and evenings. The days when groups are held vary from season to season. Currently groups are held on Tuesdays and Wednesdays, and our monthly groups are held on Thursdays. Indicate your best evening availability during the week. Groups are held at two Manhattan school locations, midtown and Harlem. 2) VOLUNTEER EVENT HELP: We rely on the generous donations from individuals, corporations, and grants to fund our work. We need a strong volunteer event committe to help with all aspects of our annual gala and other fundraising activities. 3) VOLUNTEER HELPER AND FUNDRAISING: We always need extra hand on deck for various short term projects throughout the year. The projects range from stuffing envelopes and answering phones to doing outreach in th community. Certainly if you have a particular skill aor specific time you would like to help out you should let us know. We also rely on volunteers to help with A Caring Hand, The Billy Esposito Foundation fundraising activities and other board projects. WE WELCOME VOLUNTEERS WITH A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE! APPLY TODAY! Follow this direct link: https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/ea9db3_572250eb6e1d4899bd0837d204ffdbe9.pdf or visit our website at www.acaringhand.org for an application.
10016.title: Volunteer Group Facilitators and Event Help Needed!

10014.description: The National Audubon Society’s volunteer program aims to inspire lifelong stewardship of our environment and communities, providing individuals the opportunity to develop skills needed for a successful career in conservation. Currently, volunteer opportunities are being offered in the area of Environmental Education.  Audubon invites you to become a volunteer with Audubon New York’s premier environmental education program, For the Birds! ( FTB!)NYC.  For the Birds! is a place-based elementary education program that teaches environmental awareness and appreciation of nature through the study of birds. During multiple visits, students in grades two through six learn about their local, natural environment through indoor and outdoor lessons, field trips, and a conservation project designed to provide or enhance bird habitat in the local community.   For the Birds! volunteers will assist with the implementation of the FTB!program in New York City schools and camps throughout all five boroughs.  S/he will teach this program to multiple classes/ summer camps in New York City and will also assist the FTB! Program Director with administrative duties related to the delivery and expansion of the program.  This includes, but is not limited to: curriculum development and revision, materials preparation and inventory, school set up, follow up and wrap up, and other administrative duties as needed. Volunteers will work closely with the FTB! Program Director to inspire a new generation of conservationists through the study of birds.   Interns will gain experiences in both formal and non-formal environmental education and learn valuable and transferable skills such as project management, curriculum development, volunteer management, and community engagement.
10014.title: Audubon NY's For the Birds! Education Program

07106.description: Be the role model she'll always remember. As a volunteer, you’ll introduce girls to new experiences that show them they’re capable of more than they ever imagined. You’ll be their cheerleader, guide, and mentor, helping them develop skills and confidence that will last a lifetime. Imagine the smiles, the excitement, the memories made-those are the moments you’ll share at Girl Scouts. Sound like something you’re interested in? We know you have what it takes to be an amazing volunteer and we’re here to get you started on our journey! Be the troop leader that supports her throughout the year-the one that watches her smile get bigger as she grows more confident. Mentor a Girl Scout Cookie Professional during cookie season so she can earn enough to reach the goals she and her troop set. Or work with other adults to provide the kind of behind-the-scenes support that makes it possible for her to make amazing new memories at Girl Scouts. Troop Leader/Co-Leader Work with a group of girls and mentor them as they make new friends and develop connections that will last a lifetime.

10004.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine, Inc. (\"RLC\") is a non-profit food rescue organization based in New York City that delivers leftover food from restaurants and caterers to local agencies such as homeless shelters and soup kitchens. We have thus far delivered over 1,000,000 pounds of food with the lowest cost per delivery in the industry. Our business model is centered around four stages: (1) proactively seek out businesses with leftover food for partnerships, (2) deliver excess, wholesome food directly to local agencies, (3) use our expertise in food rescue to consult each partner different ways to reduce food waste, (4) partners successfully graduate from the RLC food rescue program with reduced food cost and food waste. Position Summary: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is seeking a fundraising intern to assist in reaching out to different companies for sponsorships, help with formulation of donation campaigns, provide assistance in organizing fundraising events, and help applying for grants. Responsibilities: * Contact corporate groups to establish partnerships and sponsorships * Cooperate with other interns and employees to organize a great fundraising. * Lead and direct volunteers on the day of the fundraiser so that the event can take place on time. * Communicate with and motivate participants so that fundraising goals are met. * Write grant proposals to submit before deadlines. Qualifications: Self-motivated; ability to initiate and work independently Ability to multitask and prioritize Ability to work under pressure to meet deadline Passionate about food rescue Great communication and writing skills RLC interns have the chance to work closely with the founders and have the opportunity to make true, meaningful impact in their time with the organization. This is a part-time, unpaid internship. Interns are expected to work 20 hours per week. May lead to full-time position.
10004.title: Fundraising Intern - Fall 2018

10004.description: Fall 2018 Internship Program Rescuing Leftover Cuisine (\"RLC\") strives to become the world’s most widely used solution for companies and individuals to eliminate food waste in their communities, making food rescue sustainable and universal, and food hunger a thing of the past. RLC is a non-profit food rescue organization based in New York City that delivers leftover food from restaurants and caterers to local agencies such as homeless shelters and soup kitchens in an effort to reduce and eliminate food waste. We have thus far delivered over 480,000 pounds of food with the lowest cost per delivery in the industry. Our business model is centered around four stages: (1) proactively seek out businesses with leftover food and encourage them to donate, (2) deliver excess, wholesome food and bring it directly to homeless shelters and soup kitchens, (3) use our expertise in the food rescue industry to consult each partner different ways to manage inventory / ordering system to reduce food waste, (4) partners successfully graduate from the RLC food rescue program which reduces food waste and saves costs. RLC is currently accepting applications for the Fall 2018 Internship Program. RLC is seeking talented, entrepreneurial, and passionate young leaders with the emotional intelligence and organizational skills needed to work in a self-driven and quality-driven work environment. Position Summary: The Development Program is seeking two Development interns. The Development Interns will assist in forming partnerships with companies for sponsorships, help with formulation of donation campaigns, and provide assistance in arranging fundraising events in New York City. Responsibilities: * Contact corporate groups to establish partnerships and sponsorships * Maintain sponsorship details in database * Gather detailed information regarding charitable organizations * Assist in organization of special events with community members RLC interns have the chance to work closely with the founders and have the opportunity to make true, meaningful impact in their time with the organization. All interns will have entry, mid-stage, and final evaluations to further hone the intern’s technical and professional skills. This is a part-time, unpaid internship. Interns are expected to work 20 hours per week. May lead to full-time position. Qualifications: * Self-starter; ability to initiate and work independently * Ability to interact professionally with potential partners in person, via phone, and email * Ability to multitask and prioritize Apply Interested applicants should apply for a Fall Internship by submitting a resume. Candidates for initial phone screenings will be contacted.
10004.title: Development Intern

10004.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. The Youth Ambassador program's mission is to raise awareness, educate, and provide resources to youth in the community about gender-based violence, while empowering youth and supporting leadership development by providing a platform for youth-led activism. Youth ages 14-21 who are passionate about fighting against gender-based violence are invited to join a group of likeminded peers and make a difference in the NYC Pan Asian community! Youth meet weekly from 4:30pm-6:30pm one day a week starting in the fall. Email volunteer@iamwk.org for more information and to apply.

10001.description: MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS INTERN We are seeking an excellent communicator, writer, and avid social media user as a Marketing and Communications intern to support public relations, marketing, blog and social media for Global Goods Partners. Social Media and Web Responsibilities: Create content to grow the organization’s footprint, including social media and blog posts Research current artisan partners and product, maintain sample inventory Expand and maintain GGP’s social networking and online presence to promote GGP products, fundraising efforts, and stories of women artisan partners around the world. Create compelling narratives about GGP’s partners and work around the world. Research and update country and partner information currently on the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. PR and Events Responsibilities: Connect with influential media outlets and journalists to place stories about company news, relevant holidays, and collections Outreach to potential media partners with pitches, press releases and curated line sheets Actively pursue permanent links on like-minded sites, and assist with implementing social media strategy. Organize events designed to engage our target market. Develop and enact a strategy for digital communications with consumers and other key stakeholders to include artisan stories, product information, and resources. Personal Requirements: Excellent research, communication and writing skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Experience with social media, blogging and creating public relations campaigns Interest in and knowledge of fair trade and ethical business Able to commit to 2-3 days per week during the summer college break Specific Qualifications (a plus but not necessary): Experience in creating and implementing public relations campaigns, including familiarity with print and online media Proficiency with Photoshop, Shopify, SEO, Adwords Familiarity with e-mail marketing applications like vertical response Interest in fashion, design, or craft production Hours: 18-25 hours/week Location: 115 W 30th Street, Suite 400, New York How to Apply: Please send resume and cover letter via email to sharrison@globalgoodspartners.org No phone calls, please. Global Goods Partners is an equal opportunity employer _________________ Global Goods Partners is a non-profit, social enterprise based in NYC that is dedicated to alleviating poverty and promoting social justice by strengthening women-led development initiatives around the world. We partner with organizations, associations, and cooperatives worldwide that integrate their commitment to community development-specifically, improvements in education, health, women’s rights, and employment opportunities-with socially responsible income-generating enterprises. We create economic opportunity by offering design direction, generating demand, and bringing the unique, handmade, and quality fashion accessories that our more than 40 partners in 22 countries produce to the U.S. and international markets through our website, www.globalgoodspartners.org.
10001.title: Marketing & Communications Intern

10001.description: Institute for Immigrant Concerns, a not-for-profit providing ESOL classes for adult immigrants and refugees, started in 1997, is looking for ESL instructors. Must have Bachelor's or MA Degree and at least 2 years of English teaching experience (whether domestic or abroad). Our students are all motivated and studious adults. We put great emphasis on survival English, employment and cross-cultural awareness. Applicants should be available twice a week, on Tuesdays and Thursdays for our morning classes ( 9am-12pm). We are currently looking for ESOL teachers for the 8-week Fall cycle ( September 25-November 13), and welcome anyone with the potential of teaching future cycles. Applicants must send us a copy of their resume and a brief cover letter.
10001.title: ESOL Teachers for Adult Immigrants

10001.description: About the Institute The Institute for Immigrant Concerns (http://http://instituteforimmigrantconcerns.com/) is committed to equipping immigrant communities city-wide with English skills, computer training, job readiness, and referalls for social services. The Institute empowers immigrant families and communities in their quest for social and economic independence. To reach immigrants the Institute operates across New York City and frequently collaborates with other community groups. Our staff is as diverse as our clients and draws on talented individuals to create a powerful, sustainable impact in America's newest immigrants. Job Description The Bilingual Administrative Assistant is essential to maintaining an efficient office environment in support of Institute programs, staff, and volunteers. This position will be responsible for general office administration, organizing office resources, coordination of program activities, and program management support. This is an ideal position for those seeking administrative experience at a busy Manhattan non-profit. This program welcomes retired professionals. Though this position is primarily administrative, it presents an opportunity to get an introduction to non-profit management. Requirements: Commitment to work 3 months minimum Bilingual oral and written skills, preferably Russian but other languages welcome Excellent written and oral communication Knowledge of foreign languages Proficiency in MS Office and Excel Ability to work independently and alongside a team of staff and volunteers with a passion for immigrant empowerment Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment This internship is unpaid, but college credit may be available.
10001.title: Russian Speaking Program Assistant

10001.description: Volunteer with GripTape GripTape challenges the notion that learning must be adult-engineered and guided, and instead creates opportunities for young people to follow their passions - as inventors, designers, and producers- through the GripTape Learning Challenge. We work with underserved high school-aged youth (15-19 years old) to provide resources and support that enable them to actively construct their paths for success. It is inspiring to bear witness as youth grow and ignite their learning passions, and young people tell us again and again how empowering and transformative it is to have full control over their decisions with consistent support from a person who takes genuine, deep interest in their efforts. We’re currently seeking part-time volunteers who are committed to youth development to support GripTape young people. Serving as a \"Champion,\" this opportunity allows you to: Offer motivation and encouragement to youth who are driving their own learning Actively listen and encourage GripTape youth without guiding or advising their decision-making We provide approximately 3 hours of training by video conference. Champions hold virtual calls - Google Hangouts, Skype, FaceTime - with Challengers every few weeks during their learning journeys with youth across the U.S. for 1-3 months per learning cycle. Hours are flexible, with regular check-ins set around the schedules of the youth and Champion. To volunteer with GripTape, please sign up here.
10001.title: GripTape Learning Challenge

10001.description: The Sales & Merchandising Intern will play a critical supporting role in the detailed management of the product lifecycle process, in tracking purchase orders and product samples, in preparing weekly sales reports, and other deliverables to ensure key product development and financial deadlines are met. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Reviewing and updating selling reports weekly, and helping prepare for bi-weekly best seller/business reviews Managing product placement and creating collections on GGP’s retail and wholesale website Creating and updating line sheets and e-catalogs Assisting in maintaining and merchandising the showroom and sample closet Staying abreast of industry trends and competitor activity through weekly market research, competitive shopping and analysis In addition to daily task, will learn about pricing, product development, retail math and more Qualifications: Available minimum 3 days per week, for 4 months, starting in May 2018 Interest in merchandising and sales Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong organizational skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Must have a passionate curiosity and desire to learn about consumer and retail trends, including customer demographics, purchasing influencers, and emerging technology Specific Qualifications (but not necessary): Familiarity with Shopify SEO / SEM / Adwords Photoshop Location: 115 W 30th Street, Suite 400, New York Global Goods Partners is an equal opportunity employer _________________ Global Goods Partners is a non-profit, social enterprise based in NYC that is dedicated to alleviating poverty and promoting social justice by strengthening women-led development initiatives around the world. We partner with organizations, associations, and cooperatives worldwide that integrate their commitment to community development-specifically, improvements in education, health, women’s rights, and employment opportunities-with socially responsible income-generating enterprises. We create economic opportunity by offering design direction, generating demand, and bringing the unique, handmade, and quality fashion accessories that our more than 40 partners in 22 countries produce to the U.S. and international markets through our website, www.globalgoodspartners.org.
10001.title: Volunteer Sales & Merchandising Intern

10001.description: Thank you for your interest in Maya's Hope! Here's more about Maya's Hope: www.mayashope.org. Who should apply: Someone who has NYC event planning experience and has done events of 300 or more people. (Requirement: must have done NYC charity events and know the ins and outs of a silent auction!) When It’s flexible! We can work with your schedule, but you will need to be available all day and evening on Oct. 26th, the date of our Gala. And you will need to spend a day or part of a couple of days in our office soon for orientation. Venue: 583 Park Avenue About Maya’s Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that is dedicated to improving the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We are looking for that special person who has experience recruiting, training and supervising volunteers for a New York City Gala. We have great volunteers; we just need you to organize their efforts to help make our annual Gala spectacular! This is our biggest fundraising event of the year and the cuties we help depend on its success. This is a part-time volunteer position that involves working both onsite and virtually. You should know how to use spreadsheets and google calendar in order to organize and schedule volunteer hours. If you have the Gala background, organizational and leadership skills, and enthusiasm we need for this important position, please send the following: 1) letter as to why you are perfect for this role 2) resume If you are a suitable candidate, we will contact you and please be prepared to provide three references who have worked with you at a charity gala. If you do not have experience with charity galas and silent auctions, you will not be considered. Thank you!
10001.title: Charity Gala Event Planner needed for October 27th (Pre-Planning involved)

10001.description: We are looking for amazing and exceptional individuals to join our host committee for the Maya's Hope Lotus Ball on Friday, October 26, 2018 at 583 Park Avenue! Maya's Hope improves the quality of life of disadvantaged, orphaned and extremely impoverished children around the world. This will be the 7th Annual Gala for Maya's Hope and you can help us reach our goal of $300,000! We are looking for individuals from a wide array of backgrounds: law, medicine, entrepreneurs, real estate, finance and those who want to make a difference! Here's what is required: -Purchase your ticket upon joining ($350.00) - Attend and actively participate in a majority of Committee Meetings In person participation is assumed although a conference call option will be available for those with special circumstances or last minute scheduling issues. - Commit to raising a minimum of $4,000 for the Gala through sponsorships, ticket sales, and auction items with the goal of securing at least one sponsor, one live auction item (Auction item needs include exotic vacation destinations, airfare, unique experiences such as celebrity chef-hosted house parties, rounds of golf with local celebrities, exclusive tickets to sporting or arts event, etc.) - Solicit sponsorships from at least five companies - Solicit in-kind donations such as graphic design and photography services, discounted printing, - Hand address and personalize invitations to at least 15 individuals from your personal network for the Gala. -Be Ambassadors of Maya's Hope -Have integrity and show respect to all volunteers, members of the committee, board and humankind :) If you meet these criteria, please send an email explaining why you would like to join and please attach a copy of your resume or LinkedIn page. Please email maya@mayashope.org. If selected, you will be part of an extraordinary event which directly impacts the lives of the children we serve. Here is a video from our 2017 gala: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQyb8SHA02U&t=28s Here are photos from 2017 Gala: https://www.facebook.com/pg/MayasHope/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1748530808499062 We understand that not everyone has the time and resources to meet these expectations but still have a desire to help. To this end, there are other volunteer opportunities available for those individuals who are unable to commit to the full list of tasks outlined above.
10001.title: Host to Join Host Committee for Maya's Hope Lotus Ball 2018

10001.description: Do you love Instagram? Are you great at using social media effectively? Want to help us raise money and awareness for children in need? Then you might be just the person we are looking for! Maya’s Hope is searching for a Social Media Intern to coordinate and execute social media strategy and help with our accounts on Instagram, Facebook, and anywhere else we can get out the word about the Cutie Pies that we serve. . Maya’s Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that works to improve the quality of life for disadvantaged, orphaned and extremely impoverished children around the world, with a current focus on the Philippines and Ukraine. This role offers the intern a total immersion into a busy non-profit. You will be given an opportunity to take on as much responsibility as you want and learn as much as you want as you work to increase our social media presence, gain visibility for our organization, and help us raise the funds we need to continue our work. Key Duties -- Social Media Community Management Streamline company social media accounts (e.g. Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.) to ensure uniform content and tone of voice Update accounts on YouTube, and any other appropriate social media platforms where we are not currently represented Increase our number of followers/donors by engaging with them on a daily basis Help create and design email broadcasts highlighting our activities and children Use polls and surveys to build our social media footprint and reputation Build Facebook 'likes’ by approaching potential supporters through other social media channels and email marketing campaigns Track key social media analytics on a monthly basis, including Google Analytics, Bitly statistics, LinkedIn company stats, etc. Key Skills Required Proven written and verbal communication skills An interest in marketing, communications, and social media Strong familiarity with key social media (e.g. Instagram and Facebook) and with Google Suite (e.g. Excel, Word) An ability to consistently demonstrate integrity, hard work, and effectiveness An ability to remain calm under pressure and a robust/resilient attitude towards challenges Excellent attention to detail and a high motivation to learn Skill at prioritizing work and completing tasks An ability to work independently and think creatively Must show up on time. J If this sounds like the internship for you, please send a cover letter and resume to maya@mayashope.org.
10001.title: Social Media and Instagram Intern

10001.description: Do you have a strong passion for the development of Africa? Do you have innovative ideas on how the youth can contribute to Africa’s development? Do you want to work directly with the African Development Bank, UNHabitat, the African Union, and the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa? Do you want to attend meetings at the UN Headquarters in New York? Do you love to network and meet people from all over the world? Then this position is for you! YALDA is a networking organization that is truly Africa branded : \"By Africans, For Africa!\". YALDA is a non-profit international organization established by Harvard University students in order to create a resourceful networking database for those with a strong interest in Africa. The network is centered around YALDA branches, primarily at African universities, and serves to increase the capacity of youth in Africa for developing positive leadership skills and to espouse an honest work ethic. YALDA US works on researching opportunities in Africa, fundraising activities, working with branches, maintaining relationships with UN and compliance with regulations as a 501 (c)(3). YALDA US is planning its annual fundraising event in New York and has vacancies for Event Management Interns to report directly to the YALDA US External Liaison Officer and YALDA US President. Please note this is an UNPAID internship. Brief: The YALDA US Event Management Intern is responsible for assisting the YALDA US Branch with planning and delivery of our fundraising event in New York. The purpose of event is to fund the YALDA Youth Hub being built in Botswana. If you love Africa and would love to see her develop, then this opportunity is for you! Responsibilities: Engage businesses, organizations and individuals for ticket sale purchases Engage local businesses and international organizations for event sponsorships Manage and assist in the coordination of activities during the event Create marketing materials and prepare team members for meetings by conducting research and developing strategies Coordinate activities with business partners and corporate sponsors Promote event in social media and other relevant platforms Knowledge, Skills and Experience: Previous experience in project management or event management Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Excellent attention to detail, organization skills and accuracy of work Ability to communicate in a professional manner and develop good rapport with both internal and external parties Work independently and tackle multiple proposals simultaneously Must have a strong interest in Africa Qualifications: This is a great opportunity for undergraduate, graduate students and working professionals Advanced PC skills; including Word, Excel, PowerPoint Other Candidates preferably located in New York, NY Must have constant and reliable access to internet www.yaldaus.org www.yaldafrica.org Please send your Resume and Cover Letter to yaldarecruit@gmail.com by 15 August 2018.Please quote \"YALDA US Event Management Intern\" in the subject line.
10001.title: YALDA US Event Management Intern
10001.org: Youth Alliance for Leadership and Development in Africa (YALDA)

10001.description: We are seeking an excellent communicator, writer, and avid social media user as a Marketing and Communications intern to support public relations, marketing, blog and social media for Global Goods Partners. Social Media and Web Responsibilities: Create content to grow the organization’s footprint, including social media and blog posts Research current artisan partners and product, maintain sample inventory Expand and maintain GGP’s social networking and online presence to promote GGP products, fundraising efforts, and stories of women artisan partners around the world. Create compelling narratives about GGP’s partners and work around the world. Research and update country and partner information currently on the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. PR and Events Responsibilities: Connect with influential media outlets and journalists to place stories about company news, relevant holidays, and collections Outreach to potential media partners with pitches, press releases and curated line sheets Actively pursue permanent links on like-minded sites, and assist with implementing social media strategy. Organize events designed to engage our target market. Develop and enact a strategy for digital communications with consumers and other key stakeholders to include artisan stories, product information, and resources. Personal Requirements: Excellent research, communication and writing skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Experience with social media, blogging and creating public relations campaigns Interest in and knowledge of fair trade and ethical business Able to commit to 2-3 days per week during the summer college break Specific Qualifications (a plus but not necessary): Experience in creating and implementing public relations campaigns, including familiarity with print and online media Proficiency with Photoshop, Shopify, SEO, Adwords Familiarity with e-mail marketing applications like vertical response Interest in fashion, design, or craft production Hours: 18-25 hours/week Email resume to sharrison@globalgoodspartners.org
10001.title: Marketing and Communications Intern

10001.description: Are you looking for employee engagement or team building activities for your company, department or group? Hudson Guild’s Corporate Volunteer Programs offer a wide array of opportunities. Hudson Guild is a multi-service community center serving those who live, work, or go to school in Chelsea, with a focus on those in need. With offerings as varied as community service projects for at-risk teens, mental health counseling for low-income individuals, wellness services for older adults, arts programming, and early childhood education for children, the Guild provides services to people in need and other activities to ensure a vibrant, safe, and healthy community. Please contact Rebecca Dealy at rdealy@hudsonguild.org or 212-760-9800 for more information!
10001.title: Corporate Volunteering

10001.description: Do you love Excel? Do you love data? Do you love creating tables and doing analysis! Well, we have projects for you! We are looking for a volunteer who will help go through excel sheets and organize it to make it more efficient for us to pull some crucial data. This volunteer will need to come into our office at least 3 hours a week. Required skills: -knowledge and usage of Google Drive, Dropbox, fast typing skills, Excel -self-motivated -attention to detail -can work alone -can do pivot tables, do analysis and provide other reports that can be helpful. You will be working by yourself. It's a great opportunity to get your feet wet in international development. Volunteers who have worked with Maya's Hope have gone on to such positions in Accounting, working at an Embassy and more. Thank you for your interest! If you have a resume, feel free to forward that over so we can see your skillset! Otherwise, please email maya@mayashope.org and explain why you want to volunteer for this fun position!
10001.title: Excel Guru who loves to do analysis!

10002.description: Proven experience as a Public Relations Specialist or similar position - Experience in project management and execution of PR campaigns and initiatives - Knowledge of essential PR tasks: pitching media, drafting press releases and researching media contacts - Knowledge of public relations, communication, media, and marketing techniques - Ability to plan, organize, and coordinate media activities and promotional events - Excellent communication and public speaking skills - Strong writing and editing skills - Experience with social media platforms (Twitter, Facebook etc.) - Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment - Advanced attention to detail and problem-solving skills - Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work - Advanced MS Office skills; Outlook, Excel, Word and Powerpoint; photo and video-editing software experience a plus - BS/BA in PR, communications, journalism or relevant field RESPONSIBILITIES - Formulate public relation plans and strategies. - Support the implementation of promotional plans. - Enhance the company’s voice and presence through online and offline channels. - Manage media relations and requests; present solutions in times of PR crisis. - Write press releases, speeches, and other PR copy. - Plan and supervise events, fairs, conferences etc. - Work with business units to determine the event budget and manage expenses. - Facilitate the resolution of disputes with the public or external vendors. - Lead survey initiatives and analyze public opinion; assist with sales and market analysis of public relations programs.
10002.title: Public Relation Volunteer for a Holiday 2018 Campaign

10002.description: Civic Art Lab is a pop-up gallery and workshop space, hosted by GreenspaceNYC. Our 3-day lab addresses the concept of sustainable futures. What does a sustainable future look like? In NYC? Around the world? As populations grow, sea levels rise, and food systems are modified, what roles will sustainability and design play? In envisioning what a sustainable future is, it’s possible to imagine successful, as well as dystopian, outcomes. Civic Art Lab is hosted by GreenspaceNYC, now in its fourth iteration. GreenspaceNYC is a non-profit collaborative that develops and curates free sustainability and design education programming, hands-on workshops, and public design projects to promote and equitable and sustainable future. Our public programs take place in a range of spaces from public parks to to community spaces to vacant storefronts. Each project is created in collaboration with volunteer-artists, designers, scientists, educators, activists, and the public. The organization is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, giving it its status as a 501(c)(3) and receives material sponsorship from Material for the Arts (NYC Office of Cultural Affairs). Please fill out the following form to apply: https://goo.gl/forms/xBDVVEoVDrgmKa9Y2 Call for submissions is extended until July 15th, 2018. You'll receive a notification of acceptance by August 2018. For additional questions, please email laura@greenspacenyc.org.
10002.title: Civic Art Lab | Oct 5th-7th, 2018 | Call for workshops, exhibitions, and talks

10002.description: Why volunteering for Upbeat? Upbeat is an organization committed to the development of communities in the South of Bronx, we believe that all children are innately musical and have a right to high quality, long-term music education. We actively seek to recruit those often excluded due to economic and social barriers. The volunteer will a vocational opportunity to explore and acquire invaluable skills that are transferable to non for profit administration, individual giving, external communication, database management, among other professional fields in the area of arts management and creative industries. We believe in supporting our peers and creating an environment that is fully supportive for the members of our team. Assisting them in possible connections for future opportunities, and mentoring them in other aspects of professional and creative endeavors. Responsibilities (Training and full support will be provided): Database management (Salesforce): Pulling reports (eg. A list of students based on a specific instrument) and updating records (emails, phone numbers, student status). Assist communication efforts with parents during class registration, concerts and special events. Assists with checklists that track the status of all communication efforts with parents and prospect parents on an ongoing basis. Support the organization and communication of prospect candidates for the upcoming fall session. Other clerical duties as needed.
10002.title: Internship and Volunteer Position

10002.description: BECOME A COLLEGE ACCESS MENTOR at MANNY CANTOR CENTER! Empower a young person to make the best college choice and achieve life goals by becoming a College Access Mentor! WHAT IS OUR COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAM? This program focuses and motivates students towards achieving their learning goals, whether that be a four year college or university or a vocational or technical school. With a combination of age appropriate and appealing college access activities, and consistent encouragement, youth have the tools and resources they need to succeed personally and academically. Mentors are a key component in encouraging students, and helping them to create a plan and pathway for education. WHAT IS YOUR COMMITMENT AS A MENTOR? Work one-on-one with a student as they navigate the college application process Help your mentee with creating their college list, writing their personal statement, and researching and reviewing scholarship options Serve as a role model, providing guidance and support Commit to attending each weekly mentor session from 6-8PM on Tuesdays, beginning September 25th and ending April 30th. There will also be a mandatory orientation on Monday, September 17th. There will also be formal opportunities in the spring to stay connected with your mentee through college readiness and career awareness activities. HOW TO GET STARTED! Fill out our volunteer application by visiting: http://cerv.is/m?0038gU3a60F Share you availability for a phone call screening in the additional details section of the application Prospective mentors will need to attend an in-person group interview to be considered To ensure the safety and security of all program participants you will be required to submit to a background check APPLY TO BE A MENTOR IF... You have experience and/or interest working with college bound students You are passionate about building a strong working relationship with youth. You want the opportunity to be a positive and consistent role model and make a difference in the life of a young person You are available to commit to every Tuesday from 6-8PM WE NEED YOUR HANDS. WE NEED YOUR HEARTS. GET INVOLVED BY VOLUNTEERING!
10002.title: Volunteer to be a College Access Mentor!

10002.description: Community Outreach Volunteer(s) serves as the face and voice of their organization, helping us to bridge the gap between our non-profit and the community. Their responsibilities include: - helping us develop programs for the organization and overseeing them from inception to fruition. They also monitor programs to fit regulations and handle communications with representatives of the community. We have programs in progress but need help managing these programs. - Develop community outreach activities and programs. - Represent the organization in a variety of public settings to increase awareness. - Evaluate needs of general public and community groups. - Strong computer skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, are preferred. - ideal candidates would exude a warm, engaging, and hospitable demeanor.
10002.title: Looking for Community Outreach Volunteers

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. Responsibilities to include the following: Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive marketing and communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact, including hands-on experience with all appropriate aspects of social media Managing the ongoing promotion of major programs and developing and executing messaging for new initiatives Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of the organization’s mission and successes Working with the technology-development team to identify a set of meaningful touchpoints with our targets - new member joining, annual pledging - and creating an array of appropriate communications to be automated and sent, in order to stay current and ensure maximum engagement and support from our stakeholders. Working with all CAG committees, specifically including Development and Programming, to assist with execution of their annual plans and to help further corporate engagement efforts Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them

07086.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with Bike MS: New York City’s Rest Stop location in Weehawken! Bike MS New York City will be held on Sunday, October 21 - Rest Stop volunteers are needed from 7:00am-9:00am in Weehawken, NJ. We welcome groups and individuals of all ages and abilities to join us as volunteers! Bike MS: New York City is a unique experience - the 30 mile route around Manhattan is completely traffic free. The 50 and 100 mile rides allow cyclists to ride through the Holland Tunnel traffic free. More than 300 volunteers are needed to make this event a success! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f0944acab22abfd0-201813 Rest Stop Support Team: Date: Sunday, October 21, 2018 Time: 6:30am-9:00am Location: Weehawken, NJ Description: Volunteers will be assigned to the Weehawken rest stop which is along the Bike MS: New York City route. Volunteers will distribute water, snacks and cheer on walkers! If you have any questions, please contact: NYC Volunteer Engagement Team at NYCSNY.Volunteers@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
07086.title: Rest Stop Volunteers Needed in Weehawken for Bike MS: NYC!
