07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

10573.description: Open Door Family Medical Center is partnering with Feeding Westchester (formerly the Food Bank of Westchester), to bring a free \"market on wheels\" to the Port Chester Community. Each month fresh, nutritious food will be provided to those-in-need. The food is set up as a farmer’s market so that people can walk through and select their own food, including fresh protein, dairy, produce and grains! Volunteers will help set up and distribute food products along with breaking down cardboard boxes. Location: Open Door Family Medical Center 5 Grace Church St, Port Chester, NY (Mobile Pantry in Parking Lot on Purdy St) Requirements: Able to lift 30 lbs. Spanish Language Skills beneficial High School Students Welcome! On-line Application Completed When: One Saturday a month August 25th, Sept. 15th, October 13th, November 10th, December 15th This is an express interest listing - a follow-up email will allow you to sign-up for available time-lots. For additional information, please contact Jane Levy, Manager of Volunteer Programs: jlevy@odfmc.org.
10573.title: FREE Nutritious Food - Help Distribute at Mobile Pantry
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

10573.description: At The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS), we're passionate about our mission: to cure leukemia, lymphoma, Hodgkin's disease and myeloma, and improve the quality of life of patients and their families. LLS volunteers help carry out this mission in so many ways: supporting patients, family members, healthcare professionals, and our community, driving policy advocacy, participating in our campaigns, and helping LLS build much needed capacity. Position Summary Reporting to Debbie Griggs, the purpose of this role is to assist with specific projects and activities for LLS Procurement and Event Meeting Services. The outcomes of this role serve our mission work and will require the volunteer to perform task that may include: Assist with updating budgets, tracking expenses and review bills against rooming lists. Prepare and manage rooming lists include double checking against information in Etouches Create name badges for upcoming events Work with restaurants and venues for upcoming events Assist in sourcing venues for upcoming events Create name badges for upcoming events Input Contracts and invoices into COUPA System Assist with expense reports in CONCUR System Assist with other administrative duties and projects as needed. Location Rye Brook, NY Time Commitment Up to 20 hours per week Monday thru Thursday Qualifications Volunteer should possess the following skills/qualifications: Excellent organizational skills Excellent customer service skills Familiar with MS Office Suite Background check required: No Training LLS will provide the volunteer with an orientation to The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society as well as the following training specific to the volunteer role: Coupa Etouches Concur LLS Events Meeting Services Benefits Customer Service experience Budgeting/Expense Report experience Time Management skills Professional exposure with a Non-Profit Free Parking Computer and work space provided solely for the purpose of this project Access to LLS resources (Patient Access, etc.) Reference for college credit is possible. Need must be indicated at the time of volunteer interview for consideration. Interested volunteers should contact Quentin.Merritt@lls.org
10573.title: Procurement & Event Meeting Services Volunteer

11249.description: Our goal is to improve diagnosis and treatment for the most common chronic illness in the US - autoimmune disease. We are planning a fund raising event in New York City and are looking for someone to help organize it. Times are in reality more flexible than posted. We need an individual with passion, intelligence and initiative. This is a volunteer opportunity but if the fundraiser is successful it could lead to paid employment with ARI.
11249.title: Manager for NYC Fundraising Event

10463.description: Position Statement: Evening classes, 6:00pm-9:30pm Monday - Thursday The ESOL (English Students of Other Languages) Program Assistant will be responsible for one-on-one support to students during classroom English lesson plans, administrative support to the instructor/s, and technical aspects of assisting students with progressing computer-based language programs. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide participants with one-on-one assistance Assist with technical and administrative tasks Provide administrative back-up and support to ESOL Instructor Engage and retain students by developing supportive relationships Other duties as assigned by Instructor Qualifications: HS Diploma; Some college preferred Comfort with computer applications and data entry Available evening hours Organized, efficient, and task oriented English/Spanish Bi-lingual helpful
10463.title: ESOL Program Volunteer

08857.description: Hi Volunteer, We are very excited to announce our launch of Healthy Kids Running Series (HKRS) in Old Bridge this Fall and Next Spring and would love to have your support. We will be seeking the help of volunteers to be responsible for stretching runners, leading warm-ups, helping with on-site registration, marshaling the course, etc. We are therefore providing opportunities to promote a healthy lifestyle for kids, tweens, and teens, to meet our neighbors and make friends while providing volunteer opportunities? KiDz HuB has applied to be the Community Coordinators for the Healthy Kids Running Series in Old Bridge and we would be honored to have you as part of our team, to help to make this successful. Healthy Kids Running Series is a great way to spend time in the community and meet other families in your town. All volunteers will receive an HKRS KiDz HuB tech shirt for your help! Please sign up to volunteer with us for the Healthy Kids Running Series (HKRS) in the Fall and Spring Thanks ORLANDO \"Uncle Lanze\" DILLON Founder/Director | KiDz HuB Media Network Inc. Tel :732 HuB z HuB or 732 482 9482 Ext. 1002 | email o.dillon@kidzhub.org KiDz HuB | 3171 US Highway 9 North | Suite 317, Old Bridge NJ 08857 Facebook- www.facebook.com/KiDzHuB Twitter- www.twitter.com/ KiDzHuB Instagram- www.instagram.com/ KiDzHuB YouTube- www.youtube.com/ KiDzHuB Website- www.KiDzHuB.com

08854.description: You are invited to a free hospice volunteer orientation on Sunday, Sept 9, 9:30am - 3:30pm, Kindred Hospice, 242 Old New Brunswick Rd, Piscataway, NJ. 08854 . Gain valuable knowledge on how you can use your gift of compassion to provide friendly visits to patients with life-limiting illnesses so that they can live out their days as comfortably as possible. Visits are provided wherever the patient calls home in the central NJ area. Students in the healthcare, psychology or social work field are encouraged to attend. To sign up for this free orientation or get more information on the volunteer opportunity, contact the Manager of Volunteer Services at Elaine.Carlsen@gentiva.com or call 732-562-8800.
08854.title: Hospice Volunteer Orientation: Sept 9, 9:30-2:30

06902.description: Special Olympics Connecticut needs volunteer help at Scalzi park in Stamford on Saturday, September 8th and Sunday, September 9th with our Bocce competition. We need Bocce helpers to rake the courts, flip the score boards, serve food, and give out awards. No experience necessary.
06902.title: Unified Sports Fall Festival Bocce

06902.description: 130 volunteers are needed to support the 7th annual Domus NINER, an adult CrossFit athletic competition where awesome athletes compete for top prizes such as rubber chickens and kazoos. The money raised through sponsorships (about a quarter of a million dollars) is used to support our schools. Volunteer activities include: volunteer registration, way finding, water station, cheerleading, face-painting, handing out bananas, and other fun positions.
06902.title: Domus NINER

06902.description: Domus Open Gym Night launched this summer at our Lockwood Avenue, Stamford, location. Meant to offer a safe and fun place for teens to spend the hours between work or school and bedtime, in addition to basketball they'd like a safe place to share their creative talents. Beginning at 6:30p on Wednesday, September 26, Spoken Word Night will have its Grand Opening. and we're looking for food volunteers to to help make the evening festive. These are teenage boys and girls, so pigs-in-a-blanket, guac and chips, hummus and carrots, brownies, etc. are the height of haute cuisine! If you have the time to make and drop off a dish for 10 people, we'd appreciate it. And please consider staying for a while. Every poet needs an audience. To know more, write me.
06902.title: Spoken Word Night Food

06902.description: As a non-profit organization, the American Liver Foundation relies on the support of volunteers to keep moving forward in the fight against liver disease. The Liver Life Walk has a variety of volunteer options available. Volunteers are needed to help out in all areas of the Liver Life Walk including Registration, T-Shirt Tent, Water Stations, Route Monitors, Cheerleaders and more! Wear comfortable shoes- as you will be on your feet for a majority of this event.
06902.title: Liver Life Walk Stamford 2018

06903.description: Welcome Visitors to the Museum; answer questions about Exhibits; respond to Phone Inquiries. Docent training provided at the start of each new exhibit. Time Commitment: Minimum 3 hours per week, during Museum hours. This is an especially good volunteer opportunity for students both during summer vacation time as well as fulfilling their school community service requirements.This position can be filled by students giving one Saturday afternoon a month to the Society. Seniors looking to meet new people and continue learning about their community have found this to be an interesting way to accomplish those goals. We are flexible in that volunteers can come in weekly or biweekly depending on their schedules.
06903.title: Docent

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Historic Home Docent & Museum Greeter We are looking for volunteers who would like to introduce visitors to our 1699 historic house museum, The Hoyt-Barnum House. You would be involved with greeting visitors with a smile and giving a brief explanation of the Center's offerings: a research library, photo archive, our current exhibit, and our historic house museum. People who wish to tour Hoyt-Barnum House first view an introductory film before starting the audio tour. You would be responsible for selling tickets and recording transactions, giving guests their audio pods and collecting them after the tours, opening and closing up the house museum, and monitoring visitors while they are in the house. Minimal training is needed. Museum Docents should be friendly and personable. They should be physically able to manage stairs and brief walks on a regular basis. Docents should be at least 20 years old and able to work at least one four-hour day, 2 x /month. Docents are needed for Thursdays and Fridays. Shifts are from noon to 3:15 pm on Thursdays and Fridays. Two docents are needed on Saturday: one from 10:30 - 1:00 and one from1:00 to 3:30 pm. You are welcome to stay longer to meet our other volunteers and make use of our facility. Check out our Website for loads of fun information: http://stamfordhistory.org/ Skills needed: -Basic math/money skills Hope to hear from you soon! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator & Board Member Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org volunteer@stamfordhistory.org (O) 203-329-1183 (C) 917-701-3572
06903.title: Stamford Historic Home - Tour Guide (No experience needed)

06901.description: We are recruiting volunteers to help with the St. Jude Walk/Run to End Childhood Cancer in Stamford, CT. 06901.title: St. Jude Walk/Run to End Childhood Cancer- Stamford, CT

06901.description: Stamford Academy serves about 135 high school students who have been unsuccessful in other schools. The number of students with Individual Education Plans (IEPs) is about twice the rate of Stamford Public Schools, yet Stamford is able to provide only one SPED teacher. You know how important one-on-one instruction is. Do you have a couple of hours to spare once a week during the school year to help tutor a student? Training provided. To meet our kids is to love them. They are wary and giving; have big dreams and struggle to stay on task; are talented and funny; and may have not had dinner the night before. If you'd like to know more, please contact me.
06901.title: Do you know what an IEP is? If so, read on...

07670.description: Dear Residents of Tenafly Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
07670.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

10466.description: We are currently looking for writing/literary arts teachers for our literary programs. Words vs. Pictures: This is our visual and literary arts program and you may spend some time throughout the year working with an artist/teaching artist. You will have the opportunity to create your curriculum to teach our students different writing disciplines and engage them in projects related to self-expression/exploration, current events, and other subjects of interest. You will work with the students to create works suitable for a show/exhibit at the end of the year. Bookworms: This is our book club for young readers. The club meets once per month during the school year. Read thrilling books and do fun activities with elementary school aged children to build their love of reading. Beyond Words: This book club is for teens. The club meets once per month during the school year. Engage middle and high school students in reading books with themes relevant to today's events. We are looking for writers/teachers that can teach various literary arts disciplines - poetry, short essay, biography, etc. Please contact us whether you are interested in teaching for the whole school year, a semester, or a particular subject/discipline for a limited time. We are open to the right teacher or combination of teachers. At Artsmith, we are dedicated to providing arts education to young people in the Bronx who have little or no opportunity to experience the arts. We know that the arts provide our students with a great and safe place to learn creativity, experiment and take risks, develop discipline, and build confidence. Arts education should not be a question of access. You must believe in this mission to volunteer with us! Email resume to tricia.smith@artsmith.org to be considered.
10466.title: Writing/Literary Arts Teacher

10467.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opportunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10467.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

10462.description: Hello! We are a family-run charity English school based in China's Dragon City. If you're aiming to make a difference, travel or are taking a gap year then we might just be what you're looking for. We are searching for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10462.title: Want a Genuinely Wonderful China Experience? Join D&A Charity School and Become an English Teacher

10280.description: ZERO is proud to partner with The New York Section, American Urological Association, Inc., Columbia Presbyterian University Medical Center Department of Urology, Hackensack Meridian Health, Montefiore Medical Center Department of Urology, Mount Sinai Department of Urology, NYU Langone Health Department of Urology, and Weill Cornell Department of Urology. The 2018 ZERO Prostate Cancer Run/Walk - New York City features a 5K run/walk, 1 mile walk, Kids' Superhero Dash for Dad, and virtual Snooze for Dudes program. Stick around for the family-friendly post-race celebration. Run/walk participants will receive tech shirts, free food and prizes, and the opportunity to connect with others who are impacted by prostate cancer. The funds raised from 2018 ZERO Prostate Cancer Run/Walk - New York City are invested around the country to provide research for new treatments, free prostate cancer testing, and educate men and families about prostate cancer. No other prostate cancer charity spends more per dollar on programs - more than 85 cents. ZERO puts every donation to good use.
10280.title: 2018 ZERO Prostate Cancer Run/Walk - New York City

07003.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at Bloomfield Public Library 90 Broad St., Bloomfield, NJ Tuesdays and Thursdays 12:00-3:00 p.m., October 2, 4, 9, 11, 16 &18 2018. Volunteers work once per week for two hours or more and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 225, via email emartin@lvaep.org, or register through our website www.lvaep.org.
07003.title: Times are hard, you can help!
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

11793.description: Volunteers are needed to help with this wonderful event to find a cure for brain tumors! The Long Island Brain Tumor Walk will be held at Jones Beach, Field 5 on Saturday, September 15, 2018. We have volunteer opportunities to assist with set up on Friday, September 14th during the day and a large number of opportunities available on walk day ranging from registration and incentive distribution to cheerleading for our walkers, to solicitation of donated goods to help make the event go smoothly for all. We are looking for coffee, water, snack and fresh fruit donations If you're unavailable that day but want to help distribute marketing materials or help with sponsorship, please reach out today! To see a full list of volunteer options visit: http://events.braintumor.org/events/long-island-brain-tumor-walk/volunteer-roles/. Please note that registration/banking volunteers are required to take a training over the phone via a zoom meeting, prior to the walk. We are seeking new members to join our walk planning committee for those who want to get involved year-round to help plan and execute the walk. All funds raised through our events allow the National Brain Tumor Society to advance research and public policy to improve the availability of new and better treatments, and fuel the discovery of a cure for brain tumors. Volunteers are the bedrock our existence and this special event would not be possible without you. Thank you for your time and generosity.
11793.title: Long Island Brain Tumor Walk

11793.description: Put your passion to work as a Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Volunteer. Breast cancer is a personal cause to many people. Perhaps you have personally faced the disease or you have had friends or family members who have. Volunteers are the heart of the American Cancer Society and events like Making Strides walks simply could not happen without you. Your support will bring you community together with determination, hope, empathy, caring, and passion, so no one has to walk alone. The American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. Each event is a noncompetitive 5 mile walk that brings people together to make a difference for everyone who has been touched by breast cancer. The events raise money to fund innovative research, provide free information and support, and to help people reduce their breast cancer risk or find it early when it's most treatable. From the opening ceremony to the post-walk entertainment, a Making Strides event is a celebration of survivors and opportunity to remember loved-ones lost. It's a day that shouldn't be missed and won't be forgotten. For more information please visit www.makingstrideswalk.org/longisland or email Christine.haskell@cancer.org On your email please have your name ( first and last ), Your email address, phone number, alone with your mailing address. Opportunity Areas: Include but not limited to: *Set-up (Saturday October 14th) *Breakdown (Sunday October 15) *Sponsor Welcom/Assistance *General Event Volunteer *Check-In *Tent Volunteer *Refreshment Distribution *Route Cheerleader *Water Station(s) *Merchandise Sales *Stage Entertainment *Face Painting *Temporary Tattoo *Survivor Masseuse *Hair Decorator
11793.title: Event Volunteer - Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Walk

07470.description: At this hour-long, no commitment volunteer information session, you will learn about the Passaic County Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) volunteer program and how you can make a difference in the lives of Passaic County children in foster care. CASA volunteers are trained, dedicated adults who look out for a child's best interests while helping him or her move toward a safe and permanent home. CASAs have been best described as the \"eyes and ears\" of the Family Court. From helping siblings find permanent homes together to helping a child access needed services to uncovering information that helps reunite a loving family, CASA volunteers make an incredible difference to the lives of abused and neglected children. Currently, there are more than 250 children who are waiting for an advocate just like you. Come join us and learn more! Please RSVP here: http://www.passaiccountycasa.org/orientation/. For more information, call Jessica at 973-832-4002, ext. 201 or e-mail Jessica@passaiccountycasa.org.
07470.title: Speak up for a child in foster care
07470.org: CASA for Children of Passaic County

08901.description: Ready to change a life? Apply to become a CASA advocate for children in foster care. After training, you will be sworn in by Family Court and be assigned a child's case. You will investigate their situation, meet with relevant people in their lives including teachers, foster families etc, and make reports to be delivered at Court hearings. Training takes places Monday and Thursday Nights from 6:00 - 9:30 PM. Ends October 25th. *Commitment is key to this position -- advocates meet with their assigned child at least once a month and are expected to sign on for at least the length of one case, about 12 to 18 months* We look forward to receiving your online application: http://www.casaofmiddlesexcounty.org/volunteer-application From Samantha Schamach, Outreach Coordinator: \"One of my favorite parts of running these sessions is sitting around the table wondering who will walk through the door this week. I have meet some of the most unique, passionate and inspiring people. Not to mention the out of the box thinkers, legal whiz's, rule & procedures gurus and fierce parents and grandparents looking for their next adventure. And if you've been to one of my sessions than you know that by the end of the informal presentation we are all on a first name basis with one another, hopefully exchanging social media info or cell numbers. As we walk back out that door we are ready to greet Saturday morning with a little more bounce in our step. So who will we be meeting this weekend? Won't you join us? Cain't Wait! :)\"
08901.title: Info Session:  Become a Court Appointed Special Advocate for Children

08902.description: Dear Residents of South Brunswick Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
08902.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

07522.description: Member Duties : Two (2) Full-time and two (2) Half-time AmeriCorps member positions are available. The Construction Coordinator Aide (FT) will assist with the coordination of PHFH's construction schedule and onsite construction material logistics. The Neighborhood Development Project Assistant (FT) will build upon PHFH's neighborhood programs by fostering relationships, shaping and supporting programs that engage homeowners, volunteers and community members to help achieve neighborhood program objectives. The service opportunity will include the use of NeighborWorks surveys, GIS tools and community data analysis to document and measure program results. The Project Coordinator Aide (HT) and Home Preservation Aide (HT) will facilitate PHFH's Energy Star and Home Warranty Programs under the guidance of the Construction Project Manager which includes the coordination of homeowners, volunteers and community members on home maintenance, energy and green living awareness. Program Benefits : Training , Childcare assistance if eligible , Health Coverage , Education award upon successful completion of service , Living Allowance . ST. PAUL’S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AMERICORPS PROGRAM BENEFITS 2018-2019 AmeriCorps is the domestic version of the Peace Corps. AmeriCorps Members dedicate one year of their life to serve communities throughout the United States that are in need. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). *Part-Time Members commit to serve 900 hours (approximately 20-25 hours per week). Position Type: (2) Full-Time & (2) Part-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete by 12/31/2019: 1700 FT / 900 PT Bi-weekly Financial Stipend: $528.15 FT/ $279.61 PT Total Stipend Amount for the Service Year: $13,732.00 FT/ $ 7,270.00 PT Educational Award: $5,920.00 FT/ $2,960.00 PT *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448 Terms : Permits attendance at school during off hours , Uniforms provided and required , Permits working at another job during off hours . Service Areas : Neighborhood Revitalization , Housing , Community Outreach , Community and Economic Development . Skills : General Skills , Social Services , Trade/Construction , Communications , Architectural Planning , Non-Profit Management , Urban Planning , Business/Entrepreneur , Computers/Technology . Service Description : Paterson Habitat for Humanity (PHFH) is an Energy Star Certified, Community Builder striving to serve as many families as possible with sustainable homeownership as a catalyst for community transformation.
07522.title: Paterson Habitat for Humanity (AmeriCorps)
